loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
Khursheda is an entrepreneurial person who is married and has two children. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than six years. Little by little, with the passing of the time she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers.
Khursheda is looking for a loan to repair her house. Her house is in bad condition. She plans to repair all rooms of her house. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, for repairing house

loans.name: Marcio Ramon

texts.es:
Eñ señor Marcio Ramon es recide en la ciudad de Ocotal en Nueva Segovia en el norte de Nicaragua desde hace mas de 21 años, es esta felizmente casado, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar a quienes costea los gastos escolares, su esposa se dedica al cuido de la casa.
El señor Marcio es un empleado y labora para una intitucion del estado, el tiene aproximadamente unos 21 años de laborar para dicha institucion de  manera continua, es esta su principalfuente de ingreso para el sustento de su familia, cabe mencionar que el se desempeña como el responsable tecnico del departamento.
Este cliete se presento por primera vez a las instalaciones de Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento para realizarle unas mejoras a su casa de habitacion, el necesita comprar cemento para poder afinar algunas de las paredes de su casa asi como el pago de la mano de obra del albañil.
El señor Marcio se muestra positivo en que le sera aprobado el financiamiento ya que el no cuenta con el ingreso suficiente para poder asumir por cuenta propia el gasto de construccion, ademas es el  unico que trabaja en su familia y quiere darles un techo digno a su esposa y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcio Ramon has lived in the city of Ocotal in Nueva Segovia in the north of Nicaragua for more than 21 years. He is happily married and has three school-aged children for whom he pays school fees. His spouse is a housewife.

Sr. Marcio is employed and works for a state institution. He has worked for this institution continuously for some 21 years and this job is his principal source of income to support his family. It is worth mentioning that he serves as the responsible technician in his department.

This client came to Ceprodel for the first time to apply for funding in order to make some home improvements. He needs to purchase cement in order to perfect some of the walls of his house as well as to pay for construction workers.

Sr. Marcio appears positive that he will be approved for funding because he does not have sufficient earnings to be able to assume the cost of construction on his own. As well he is the only one who works in his family and he wants to give his wife and children a roof over their heads that is worthy of them.

loans.use: to purchase cement and to pay for workers.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: В свои 34 года Нигора имеет собственный семейный бизнес. Она занимается закупом, откормом и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Но главное в ее жизни то, что она любимая жена и прекрасная мама двоих мальчишек. Нигора занимается животноводством вместе с мужем. Они в этой области уже 6 лет. Она просит кредит, чтобы расширить свою деятельность. Нигора сама ухаживает за скотом и у нее это прекрасно получается. Нигора всегда отличалась своим упорством и настырностью. Она уверена, что ее бизнес и дальше будет продвигаться хорошо.
texts.en:
At 34 years of age, Nigora has her own family business.  She purchases, raises, and sells cattle.  However, the most important thing in her life is that she is a loved wife and a great mother to her two sons.  Nigora raises cattle with her husband.  Together, they have been working in this area for 6 years already.  

She is asking for a loan to expand her business.  Nigora takes care of the cattle by herself and she is very good at it.  Owing to her persistence and decisiveness, Nigora has always stood out.  She is confident that her business will continue to do well.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for sale

loans.name: Maamuu

texts.en:
Mr. Maamuu is 45 and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Anhtuya, works at a local hospital, and his two children study at a local college and secondary school. 

Maamuu has been providing wooden furniture and items in a manufacturing business at home since 2004. He is a talented craftsman and always pleases his clients with his quality and tasteful works. 

He has just received an order for children's wooden toys from a local kindergarten and needs to purchase inventory to meet the order. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to produce wooden toys for the local kindergarten. 

He is a hardworking, talented and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to produce wooden toys for a local kindergarten.

loans.name: Eric De La Paz

texts.es:
Eric  tiene 46 años de edad, es casado con 4 hijos. Es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos que asisten a la escuela.

Se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres;  para llegar a la parcelas camina 500 metros y trabaja durante toda la mañana, mientras su esposa durante la mañana ordeña y se dedica a  vender la leche y luego en el transcurso de la tarde el cuida los animales en los potreros que alquila.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar dos vaca lecheras y producir mas leche para la venta y  obtener más ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Con los ingresos, planea comprar un terreno donde tener los animales ya que alquila actualmente y le sale mas caro mantenerlos
texts.en:
Eric is 46 years old and married with four children. He only has a ninth grade education. He gets up at 4 a.m. together with his wife and children, who go to school.

He is a farmer, a task he learned from his parents. In order to arrive at his land, he walks 500 meters to get there and works throughout the morning, while his wife, at the same time, milks cows and sells the milk. Then during the afternoons, Eric cares for the animals in pastureland that he rents.

The loan he is applying for is to purchase two milk cows so he can produce more milk for sale and obtain more earnings to support the family. With these earnings, he plans to purchase land where he can keep his animals since currently he rents pasture and thus they are more expensive to maintain.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows and produce more milk for sale.

loans.name: G.s El Arca De Noe Ii Group

texts.es: El G.S. El arca de Noé II está constituido por 3 integrantes entre ellos Petrona de 51 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de  granos variados como el cacao, semilla de jícaro, maní, frijol blanco, entre otros, también es propietaria de una disco móvil que pone a servicio de cualquier evento social, es una mujer honrada y con deseos de superación, Maribel tiene 56 años de edad también forma parte de este grupo, ella también vende granos variados y de dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, como ropa prendas y otros tiene clientes fijos y eventuales desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder salir adelante, Jesús de 22 años de edad también forma parte del grupo y ella también tiene las mismas actividades económicas anteriores, con la diferencia que ella vende su mercadería de manera ambulante, en las distintas paradas de autobuses, actualmente su negocio más fuerte es la venta de granos básicos, pero debido a que este producto se mueve más nunca tiene en existencia ya que ellos distribuyen cada dos días este producto a sus clientes. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir más en sus productos ya que su demanda ha incrementado y así poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y darle mantenimiento a la disco movil.
texts.en:
The village bank El Arca de Noé II is made up of three members. Among them, Petrona, 51, makes her living selling varied grains like cocoa, gourd seed, peanuts, white beans, among others. She is also the owner of a mobile disco that is put to service at any social event. She is an honorable woman and desires to improve.

Maribel, 56, also forms part of this group. She also sells various grains and makes her living selling general merchandise, like clothes, apparel and others. She has regular and occasional customers. From a young age she has worked to be able to get ahead.

Jesús, 22, also forms part of the group. She also has the same businesses mentioned earlier, with the difference that she sells her products in the street, in the far away bus stops. 

Currently their strongest business is the sale of basic grains. Due to the fact that this product sells more, it never stays in stock. Thus, they distribute this product every two days to their clients. The objective of this loan is to invest more in their products given that its demand has increased. Therefore, they will be able to offer a better service to their customers and give better maintenance to the mobile disco.

loans.use: to invest in perishable products like gourd seed, cocoa, peanuts, and maintain the mobile disco among other things.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar, 25 years old, lives with his wife, daughter, mother, and sister in an old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician for one and half years. His wife is trained as a Mongolian language and literature teacher but she is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after their daughter. His mother works as gardener for a private entity. 

Uuganbayar is requesting a loan of 4000000 Mongolian Tughriks to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, shingles, fiberglass, and foam. With these materials, he wants to repair and insulate his family's home, making it a warmer and more comfortable place. The renovated house will allow his family to burn less coal for heating, and thus release fewer pollutants into the atmosphere. Uuganbayar is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 58-year-old married woman from Polo, Dapitan City, who has one child. She has been a member of the Paglaum-MPC for almost seven years. 

Elizabeth owns and manages a small eatery in front of their house, which is on a national road that many people pass through looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to their city, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes and also to repair the site in order to draw more people to visit her eatery. To fund this project, she needs additional capital, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to pay for expenses of her eatery

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб фармацевт, живет и работает в районе Хуросон. Ему 38 лет. Он женат и вместе с ними еще живут его родители, братья и невестки. Сухроб имеет высшее медицинское образование. Он одним из первых открыл в своей местности аптеку. Жители его района за лекарством не ходят далеко. Они покупают медикаменты в аптеке Сухроба. Сухроб в течение 5 лет успешно занимается купле-продажей медикаментов. В бизнесе ему помогает брат. Сейчас Сухроб обратился за кредитом, чтобы закупить медикаменты в свою аптеку и таким образом увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Suhrob is a pharmacist who lives in the region of Khuroson.  He is 38 years old and married.  With them, live his parents, his brothers and his sisters-in-law. Suhrob has an advanced medical degree.  He was one of the first people in his region to open a pharmacy.  Residents of his area no longer have to go far for medicine.  They purchase their medical supplies from Suhrob's pharmacy.  For the last five years, Suhrob has been successfully engaged in purchasing and selling medicine.  His brother is helping him run the business.  

Currently, Suhrob is asking for a loan to purchase medical supplies for his pharmacy in order to increase the turnover of his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for the pharmacy in order to increase merchandise turnover

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 57 years old and married with four children.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, eggs, spices, etc..

Cecilia has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years, and also earns an income from a buy and sell charcoal business.

Cecilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 71 years old, a widow with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur helping her children.

Flordeliza has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like linen, thead, and other spare parts for the maintenance of her machine.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 37 years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like linen, thead, and other spare parts for the maintenance of her machine

loans.name: Marolyn

texts.en:
Marolyn is 40 years old and married with one child who is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marolyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and piglets.

Marolyn has been raising pigs for ten years, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets

loans.name: Isidro Arsenio

texts.es:
Isidro es originario de la ciudad de Sebaco, con una edad de 49 años, su estado civil es acompañado, no tiene hijo, se caracteriza por ser un hombre de origen campesino, humilde y muy trabajador. Con los créditos recibidos anteriormente han sido de gran impacto económico en su familia ya que ha podido resolver problema económico.

Su oficio es operador de planta eléctrica en una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace ochos años y manifiesta sentirse alegre poder desempeñar este tipo de trabajo que lo aprendió cuando el emigro del campo a la ciudad ya que la situación del campo ha empeorado porque las cosechas no son tan buenas por los cambios climáticos.

Con el crédito aprobado lo va destinar para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena. Cemento, piedra cantera y madera ya que está realizando mejora en su vivienda.
Isidro agradece a Kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que es una manera de ayudar al bien estar de las familias de pocos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Isidro is a native of the city of Sebaco. He is 49 years old and he lives with a partner. He does not have children. He is known as a man of peasant origins, unassuming and very hardworking. The previous loans he has received have had a great economic impact on his family because they have enabled him to solve his financial problems.

He has had a position as a power plant operator in a joint water and sewer service for eight years and states he is happy to be able to perform this type of work, which he learned when he emigrated from the countryside to the city since the situation in the countryside has worsened because the harvests are not as good due to climate changes.

He will use his approved loan to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, quarried stone and wood because he is making improvements to his home.

Isidro is grateful to Kiva for the support they provide because this is a way of helping ensure the well-being of families with limited economic resources.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, quarried stone and wood.

loans.name: Lissette Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lissette del Socorro es comerciante de uno de los Mercados de la ciudad de León, sale de su casa de habitación a las 6:00 am para iniciar sus labores a las 7:00 am finalizándolas a las 5:00 pm, viaja a Managua una vez por semana a comprar  su producto. Ella es madre de dos hijos y  están  de edad escolar.

Inicio su negocio de forma ambulante con venta de ropa en pequeña cantidad actualmente tiene puesto fijo y realiza esta labor desde hace 14 años, al igual que la venta de ropa vende chicha la cual prepara por la tarde para la comercialización de la misma al día siguiente por la mañana

El crédito que solicita a Ceprodel lo utilizara para la compra de: maíz, leña, ropa interior, etc. Permitiéndole atraer más clientela e incrementando las ventas y ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

Los sueños de la señora es que su negocio se mantenga para que sus hijos sean profesionales coronando una carrera en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lissette del Socorros is a merchant at one of the markets in the city of León.  She leaves her house at 6:00 a.m. in order to start her work at 7:00 a.m.  She finishes work at 5:00 p.m.  She travels to Managua once a week to buy her products.  She has two school age children.

She started her business selling small quantities of clothing in an itinerant manner.  She currently has a fixed stand, and she has been doing this work for 14 years.  In addition to selling clothes she sells ‘chicha’ [a corn based drink], which she makes in the afternoons.  She sells it the next morning.

The loan she is requesting from Ceprodel is to buy corn, firewood, and underwear, etc.  This will allow her to attract more customers.  This will increase her sales and profits to provide for her family.

Her dream is to maintain her business so that her children will become professionals with a career in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and underwear, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel's dairy farm provides nearly all of his family's income. Production costs are increasing, while milk costs have remained stable so Angel is making less money than he used to. 

He is investing in a 20-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa to reduce his costs. By treating the abundant cow manure generated daily on his farm using his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will be able to produce renewable biogas and potent biofertilizer, displacing fossil-fuel based liquefied petroleum gas and agrochemical fertilizer on-site. 

This loan represents 40% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Fayoz

texts.ru: Фаёз житель района Спитамен севера Таджикистана. Ему 25 лет. Он женат и живет у родителей. Фаёз собирается открыть бизнес по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Он имеет коровник во дворе дома, а также имеет немного сбережение. Фаёз просит кредит, чтобы закупить двух голов коров и корм для скота, чтобы начать бизнес. Он планирует откармливать скот в течение двух месяцев и затем продавать на местном скотном рынке. Вся семья Фаёза поддерживает его в начинании бизнеса и в дальнейшем будут помогать ему в ведении бизнеса. Фаёз очень целеустремленный молодой человек. Если он берется за что-либо, то доводит его до совершенства. Так и в новом бизнесе Фаёз поставил себе цель преуспеть.
texts.en:
Fayoz is a resident of Spitamen, in the north of Tajikistan.  He is 25 years old.  He is married and lives with his parents.  Fayoz is planning to start a business in raising and selling of cattle.  He has a cowshed in his yard as well as some savings.  Fayoz is asking for a loan to purchase two cows and cattle feed to start his business.  He is planning to fatten the cattle for two months and then to sell them at a local market.  

Fayoz's entire family is supporting him at the start of this enterprise and in the future they will help him run the business.  Fayoz is a very driven young man; if he decides to do something, he sees it through until the completion.  For his new business, Fayoz made a goal for himself, to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase two cows and cattle feed to start a business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of ready to wear clothing to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Mila has been in this business for five years; she earns more income from pig fattening.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Nolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nolita works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Nolita is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients, such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc., for her bakery business.

Nolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc., for her business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge  es una persona soltera de 51 años de edad, que estudio hasta noveno grado nunca se caso o acompaño. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. a realizar sus actividades  diarias.

 se dedica a la agricultura, gracias a que sus padres le enseñaron. para llegar a la parcelas camina 1 kilómetro y  trabaja durante la mañana y luego en el transcurso de la tarde trabaja realizando labores de jornal.

El préstamo lo esta solicitando, para comprar el abono, la semilla, veneno para sembrar y obtener una buena cosecha para su sustento.  En un futuro piensa comprar vacas lecheras y producir leche para la venta.
texts.en: Jorge, 51 and single, studied until the 9th grade. He has never married or been in a common-law marriage. He gets up at 5:00 am to carry out his daily activities. He works in agriculture, thanks to his parents, who taught him. To get to the plots of land, he walks one kilometer and works during the morning. Then in the afternoon, he works as a day laborer. He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, seed, and pesticides to plant and get a good harvest to support himself. In the future, he wants to buy dairy cows and produce milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and pesticides to plant and get a good harvest to support himself.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas y nacatamales ubicado en su casada de habitación en la ciudad de León, lo inició de forma ambulante donde ha logrado obtener mayor clientela.
Es madre soltera de seis hijos los cuales uno está a su cargo, inicia sus labores a las 5:30 am el cual finalizándolas a las 4:30 pm.

La señora María Luisa  solicita un crédito a Ceprodel  el que  utilizara  para compra de maíz, leña, granos básicos.

Los sueños de la señora es que su negocio se mantenga para que su hijo sea un profesional coronando una carrera en un futuro.
texts.en: Maria Luisa has a business selling tortillas and nacatamales (corn, meat, and rice wrapped in a banana leaf) located in her home in the city of Leon. She started it as a street vendor, where she was able to gain more customers. She is a single mother of six children, of whom one is in her care. She starts work at 5:30 am, finishing at 4:30 pm. Maria Luisa is asking for a loan from Ceprodel, which she will use to buy corn, firewood, and dry grains. Her dream is that her business stays around so that her son can be a professional, achieving a degree in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and dry grains.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Otgonchuluun

texts.en:
Otgonchuluun is 41 years old and lives with his four children in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Guravn-tes district of Umnugovi province in Mongolia. His son, Dashdondog, is 15 years old and is enrolled in a special training college this year. His child, Yanjinlham, is 13 years old and his twins, Otgonchimeg and Otgonbayar, are 6 years old. All of his children are local school students. 

Otgonchuluun has been producing souvenirs at home since 2004. He has been taking care of his four children and paying their educations fees all by himself for years and now he wants to send his older son to get better education as heavy truck operator. 

Otgonchuluun is requesting loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks to pay 50% of his son's tuition and to cover school expenses and materials for his younger children. He is a hardworking, caring, and loving father of four.

loans.use: to pay his son's 50% of tuition and younger children's school expenses and materials

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 35-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 3 and 6 years old. He describes himself to be focused and determined. Julius operates a wholesale store where he sells wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and other consumables. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. Julius' business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are retail shops, schools, etc. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. 

Julius will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add to his stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, and other items he sells in his store. His business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to sustain his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to his stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, and other items that he sells wholesale.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором молодая незамужняя девушка в возрасте 27 лет. Она живет с отцом и матерью в городе Куляб. Дилором умеет шить и кроить. Она училась у опытной портнихи шитью женских национальных платьев. Теперь когда она овладела этой профессией, она хочет применить свои способности на деле. Для этого ей нужна швейная машинка. Чтобы реализовать свою цель, она обратилась за кредитом. Дилором хочет купить модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку и начать дело. Она будет принимать заказы у себя дома. Дилором планирует в день вышивать по два платья. Это очень прибыльный бизнес, так как услуги швеи всегда востребованы.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a single young woman of 27 years.  She lives with her father and her mother in the city of Kulob.  Dilorom knows how to sew and how to tailor.  From a skilled dressmaker, she learned how to sew women's traditional national dresses.  Now that she has mastered this profession, she wishes to apply her skills to her own business; for this, she needs a sewing machine.  

Dilorom is asking for a loan to purchase a modern, computerized sewing machine to start her business.  She will be taking orders at her house and she is planning to sew two dresses per day.  This is a very profitable business because there is always a high demand for these services.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine in order to open a tailoring business

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail store where she sells secondhand clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. 

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add a stock of secondhand clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en:
Wallace is a Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be aggressive. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his vehicle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are the general public. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to repair his motor vehicle. His business goal is to increase the number of vehicles to three within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a tour company. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Fritz Andrew

texts.en:
Fritz Andrew is a full time businessman selling used shoes. He is a resident of Lower Dicayas, Dipolog City. He is 24 years of age, single in status, but has one dependent child. He has been in this business for four years. 

He can generate at least PHP 30,000 of gross income with this business monthly. He has been a member of the Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative- Dipolog Branch for almost a year. Since he became a member, this is his third loan cycle. 

The purpose of this loan is to purchase additional stocks of shoes for display. He will use the profits for business expansion and education for his children soon.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of shoes.

location.town: Dipolog-Lower Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 28-year-old, married woman. She has two children, ages 3 and 6 years old. She describes herself as determined and God-fearing. She operates a hotel [restaurant], where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy additional furniture for her hotel. Her business goal is to open a modern hotel within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will stabilize and sustain her family. This is her second loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy additional furniture for her hotel [restaurant].

loans.name: Sajjad

texts.en:
Sajjad is a very hardworking and active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife and all of his children are students. Since 2002, he has been running a shoe shop, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells ladies and gents shoes in his shop. Currently he needs to purchase products for his shop but finds it difficult due to a lack of finances. 

Sajjad has requested from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan a loan to purchase a new variety of ladies and gents shoes to sell. He wishes to provide quality education to his children. He is very much thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a new variety of shoes to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a bona fide resident of Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married and has five children. He is 53 years old and has been operating his business for 15 years. He has lots of customers in his community. 

He has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since Oct.18, 2006. He's already had 11 loan availments from Paglaum MPC with no records of default. This loan is intended to get additional capital for his furniture materials.

loans.use: to raise additional capital to pay for his furniture materials.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 49-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. Two of her daughters are married and her four sons are living with her. Her sons are doing jobs at different firms and participate equally in the expenses of the household. 

Her husband owns a flower shop where he sells flowers of various types. His main profession is to decorate the cars and wedding beds for marriage ceremonies. In his area, he is very famous for his art. Most people like to decorate their cars and wedding beds from him. He has been running this business since 1970. The flower selling business is not a profitable business and their family barely fulfills their needs. Now the marriage season is going to start but he does not have sufficient stock of flowers to cope with the sudden increase in demand. Therefore, Rasheeda requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband  to buy more roses, jasmine and chrysanthemum flowers. Rasheeda hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to the business and in their lives. Now she will be able to save more than she did in the past.

Rasheeda praises their cooperation and says thank to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy roses, jasmine and chrysanthemum flowers to provide decoration services.

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en:
Nabeel owns a cosmetics shop in the area of Punjab, Pakistan. He is a very hardworking and young borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is running [his business] successfully. He offers a variety of cosmetics to his customers.

Nabeel has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetics for his shop. Although he has a huge stock of cosmetic products, all the products he offers are not brand names, which is affecting his sales negatively. Nowadays, people are brand-conscious and prefer to purchase brand-name products. So Nabeel wants to replace old products with new brand-name products. By doing so, he will be able to attract a huge number of customers, which will gradually increase his products sales and net income as well. With the profit amount, he wants to save money for his sister's marriage. He is thankful to the all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cosmetic products

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 31 years old. She is single and has two children. She has a motorcycle transport business. She has been in this business for three years and her current income is Kenya Shillings 9,500. 

She will use this loan to add to her savings and purchase another motorcycle. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan with KADET LTD. 

Christine's hopes and dreams for the future is to have a successful business and happy family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 38 years old and does dairy farming in Nairobi town. He is married to Sarah who also provides income in support of the family. He has two children 12 and 3 years old, respectively. He has been in the business for 12 years and right now his monthly income from his dairy farming business is Kenya shillings 20,000.

He will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow, which will enable him to get more milk supply. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan and other bills such as electricity. This is his sixth loan with KADET LTD.

His previous loans were repaid successfully and in the future, James hopes to be a large-scale dairy farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne runs a retail shop in Kitengela town. She is 31 years old and married with two children. Her husband also supports the family. She has been in this business for three years and currently makes a monthly income of Kenya Shillings 20,000. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of goods to sell in her retail shop, including flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, and cosmetics. She will also add more money float to her mobile money transfer (M-pesa) business. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the anticipated profits to open another mobile money transfer business.

In the future, Yvonne hopes to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell and to increase her float for doing money transfers

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is 36 years of age, married and blessed with three children. He sells vegetables in Kangundo town and has been in this business for 10 years. He also runs a retail shop.

This will be his second loan and he plans to use it to buy more vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes to sell. He also plans to buy more retail goods such as sugar, bars of soap and rice to sell in his retail shop. 

He will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children. Cosmas hopes to be successful in his business and therefore be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married lady, age 45. She is a mother of four children, ages 27, 23, 21, and 14. She operates a clothing shop in Ololulung'a area and has been running the business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She has borrowed a third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase more clothing for the business. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children.

Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 45 years old, married, and a mother of six children, ages between 18 and 5 years respectively. She has been running a retail shop in Narok town for the last two years, getting a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Judith learned about Kadet from one of her regular customers, who is a Kadet registered member. Judith has been issued a second loan of KES 50,000 after successfully paying off the first one. 

She plans to use the funds to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products. The anticipated profits will be reinvested back in the business for expansion. Her dream is to diversify to a tent hire business.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop.

loans.name: Tayiana

texts.en: Tayiana is 50 years old, married and a mother of two children. She has been running a retail shop for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. She learned about KADET from a group of farmers in her neighborhood who are already being funded by Kadet Ltd. With her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET, she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products. The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life

loans.use: to add more stock to her retail shop

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 26-year-old married man. He has two children with ages of three months and three years. He describes himself to be self-determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. 

He has been involved in this business for one and half years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to service the motorbike and open another business. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service the motorbike and open another business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 37 years old and single. She supports three members in her family. She works in Nairobi Town, where she makes handbags. She has been in this business for eight years. She currently makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings. She plans to use this loan to buy materials to make more handbags to sell. These include different types of thread, wool, buttons and beads for decorating the handbags. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more materials and make more handbags. Alice hopes to open a big boutique and sell various types of handbags.

loans.use: To buy materials for making handbags.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 32-year-old man, married to Esther and the father of two children. He is a mechanic and has been in this business for 12 years now. He makes a monthly income of 43,000 shillings.

This will be Peter's third loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology Ltd. He plans to use the whole amount to buy a heavy duty grader. In the future, he wants to open another welding shop.

loans.use: To purchase a heavy duty grader

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the town of Kutaisi, West Georgia. He is 45 years old, and his family consists of his wife, retired mother and 19-year-old son. David is running the agricultural business for the family. They own an ox and six sheep. The family earns additional income through the sale of wine and vodka produced by grapes harvested from their family-owned 30 vines. David transports firewood from the forest and sells it among locals to generate income as well.

He requested credit to purchase fifteen sheep and build a cattle-shed for them. He will breed the sheep and start selling lambs in a nearby town's open market. The income of the family will increase. 

In the future, David plans to reinvest part of the income from the sheep-breeding business for its further development. The other part of the increased income will be used to improve the daily living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and build a cattle-shed for keeping them.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is married and has six children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a cereal-selling business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase rice, maize and beans, for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, maize and beans, for resale

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman, who has been blessed with three children. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Mwaka has been operating a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. With the Kshs 50,000 loan funds, she wants to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гульбаре 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гульбары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульбара занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульбары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, 7 овец, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульбара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульбара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Gulbara is 53 years old, married, and raising three children with her husband.  She has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this field 17 years ago when she bought livestock for 10,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to her hard work, Gulbara now owns two dairy cows, two young bulls, seven sheep and one horse.  She makes a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, Gulbara has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some young bulls and increase her cattle headcount.  She plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.  She also intends to save some money to continue to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy young bulls.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia  posee un negocio de venta de comida ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace 40 años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia. Sale de su casa de habitación a las 6:30 am  abre su negocio a las 7:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 5:00 pm este trabajo  lo realiza  de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario,  Su negocio lo inicio de forma ambulante,  el capital con  que inicio fue producto de sus ahorro.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar materiales de construcción como: cerámica, cemento, arena, etc., los cuales serán empleados para la mejora su centro de trabajo el cual le permitirá brindarle una mejor atención a su clientela.
texts.en:
María Eugenia has a business selling food from one of the central markets in the city of Leon.  For the past 40 years she has done this work and it is how she supports her family.  She leaves her house at 6:30 AM and opens her business at 7:00 AM. She typically finishes working at 5:00 PM in the evening.  She works from Monday to Saturday during these hours.  At the beginning she sold her products on foot, but with her savings she was able to open her business.

She is seeking a loan from CEPRODEL to buy construction materials such as ceramic tiles, cement, sand, etc. which she will use to improve her work space so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles, cement, sand, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo posee un negocio de venta frutas y verduras, ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de león.

El inicia sus labores a las 5 am para ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad de frutas frescas así como verduras retirándose a su hogar alas 4:00 pm para descansar.

El crédito que está solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de frutas frescas de la temporada y otros productos como: bananos, tomates, chiltomas, entre otras, para así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos de mejor calidad para satisfacerles su demanda por lo que tendría más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Leonardo runs a fruit and vegetable business located in one of the markets in the city of Leon.  He begins working at 5:00 AM so that he can offer his customers a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables.  He returns home at 4:00 PM to rest.

He is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to use in the purchase of fresh, seasonal fruits and other products such as bananas, tomatoes, peppers, etc.  He wants to offer a variety of high-quality products to his customers and satisfy their needs so that he can earn a higher income and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a new client. She is married to Amos and they have three children. They reside in a rural area near Mbarara District. She applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings.

Lydia has a good banana plantation and a part-time business selling goats. With this loan, she wants to increase her purchase of goats, so as to increase her earnings and improve the livelihood of her family members. She also wants to pay school tuition for her children in better schools in the country. Her dreams are to become a regional goat dealer and buy her own transport van for her business to get to the market. She is always limited by capital, and yet, she has enough experience in her business. With this loan, she is sure that her stock will increase and she will also improve her banana plantation.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Eliza

texts.ru: Элизе 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 дочь. У Элизы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Элиза занимается животноводством, стартовав 3 года назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Элизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 бычка, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элиза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Элиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Eliza is 23 years old, married, and she has one daughter whom she raises with her husband.  She has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business three years ago when she bought livestock for 20,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to her hard work, Eliza now owns one dairy cow, two young bulls and one horse.  She makes a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, Eliza has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some calves and therefore increase her livestock headcount.  She plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her herd of domestic animals, and also intends to improve her family's material conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Doña Santos es una mujer fuerte y luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse, con un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo financiero de sus padres a pesar de las dificultades económicas y la poca variedad de centros educativos en la zona donde ella habita. Ella tiene 32 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos, casada y solo ella y su familia se involucran en las diferentes actividades que en el campo se realizan. Ella también tiene una pulpería la cual le permite generar ingresos para su familia y ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos que a diario se presentan. Ella también se dedica a la siembra de Chile, tomate y granadilla lo cual aprendió de su pareja siendo sus clientes los vecinos y amigos de la zona como también algunos que llegan a la misma en busca de su producto por la calidad e higiene que ofrece al momento de la cosecha y en el proceso.  

Sus planes para el futuro es agrandar más sus cultivos, fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos los cuales desde pequeños están comprendiendo el valor que tiene para sus padres trabajar con honestidad y transparencia, por lo que hoy en día Doña Santos ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 10 QQ de abono 18-46-00, 10 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 8 kilos de manzate, 8 kilos de conter, 6 botes de curion, 6 botes de muralla, 9 kilos de macoceb y 8 QQ de gallinaza para dar protección a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Santos is a strong, hard-working, entrepreneurial woman with ambitions to get ahead. She completed primary school thanks to the financial support of her parents (despite their economic difficulties) and because there were a few schools in the area in which she grew up.  

She is now 32 years old, she is the mother of 5 children, and she is married.  Santos and her family engage in the different agricultural activities that people commonly do in the region.  She also owns a small store that enables her to earn an income for her family and with which she helps her husband pay the daily household expenses.  

She grows chili, tomato, and granadilla which her husband taught her to do, and her customers are her neighbors and friends.  They come looking for her products because of their quality and the care she puts into harvesting and processing them.

Her future plans are to increase her crops and strengthen the example that she gives her children who have understood since they were small the value in hard, honest and transparent work.

Santos is seeking a loan which she will use to buy fertilizers, fungicide, herbicides, and other chemicals to protect her crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her chili, tomato, and granadilla crops.

loans.name: Abdulo

texts.ru: Абдуло живет в деревни. Его деревня находится далеко от города, где природа подарила людям возможность для развития сельского хозяйства. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому Абдуло является единственным кормильцем семьи. Абдуло более 10 лет занимается купле продажей сельхоз культур. Он имеет довольно большой опыт в бизнесе и сам справляется с бизнесом. Абдуло несколько лет назад начал строить жилой дом для своей семьи, но не закончил еще, так как есть некоторые объекты, которых надо завершить. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Abdulo lives in the countryside.  His village is located in a remote area, where nature makes it possible for people to work in agriculture.  Abdulo is married and raising three children.  His wife is a homemaker, so he is the only breadwinner in his family.

Abdulo has been buying and selling agricultural crops for more than ten years.  He has a good experience in his field of work and manages his business alone.

A few years ago, he started to build a house for his family.  However, the house is not finished yet: there are a few things that need to be completed.  Abdulo is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement and wood.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood in order to build a new house.

loans.name: Farukh

texts.ru: Любому человеку вдали от Родины всегда тяжело, вот и Фаруху из района Яван тоже далось нелегко. Он два года и четыре месяца работал в Российской Федерации в одном из магазинов, простым продавцом. Ему надо было кормить свою семью. Сейчас Фарух живет с матерью, братьями и сестрами. Его отец уехал в заграницу на заработки. Фарух развелся со своей женой. Развод  дался ему нелегко, но не сломал его. Он решил открыть свою точку и продавать мужскую одежду. Фарух приобрел торговую точку на рынке района. Для закупа товара ему не хватает еще немного денег и он обратился за кредитом. На сумму кредита Фарух хочет приобрести ассортимент сезонной мужской одежды. Он все делает для улучшения жизни своей семьи. Он больше не хочет покидать родину, а наоборот планирует в будущем продвинуть и расшить свой новый бизнес.
texts.en: Just as it is difficult for any person to be far from their homeland, it was difficult for Farukh from Yavan. He worked for two years and four months as a simple clerk in a store in Russia. He needed to feed his family. Now Farukh is living with his mother, brothers, and sisters. His father went abroad to work. Farukh is divorced. The divorce wasn't easy, but it didn't break him. He decided to open his own shop and sell men's clothing. Farukh has a stall at the area market. He needs a bit more money to buy goods, so he is asking for a loan. He would like to use the funds to buy a variety of seasonal men's clothing. Everything he does is to improve his family's life. He doesn't want to leave his country again, and instead plans to advance and grow his new business.

loans.use: To obtain a variety of seasonal men's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rita Guadalupe

texts.es: Rita, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y tiene 3 hijos, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Rita trabajo por varios años en una maquiladora. Hace 3 años inicio su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada para damas, caballeros y niños como ser camisas, pantalones, camisetas, blusas, vestidos etc. Ella vende en su casa, en el mercado y de manera ambulante. Actualmente ha solicitado este préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar dos fardos de ropa de segunda mano para vender. El plan que tiene es trabajar duro para mejorar la capacidad económica.
texts.en:
Rita is 32 years old. lives with her common-law husband and three children in the Municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Rita worked for a number of years in a factory. She started her own business three years ago selling used clothing for women, men and children. Clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses, T-shirts, dresses, etc. She sells from her home, at markets and in the street.

Rita has requested  a loan of 15,000 HNL  to buy two bundles of used clothing to re-sell. Her plan is to work hard in order to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of used clothing for woman, men and children for resale.

loans.name: Bless Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is in her late 20s, is a married woman with a baby boy aged one year old. For a period of a year and a half now, Grace has been running a poultry business. She starts working from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. daily, but sometime until the night hours, especially when she has chicks. She is able to make a good profit per month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Grace's first loan request, which will be used to open another poultry business in another place. Grace is working so hard and her husband's support makes her feel more energetic, especially in long working hours. 

Grace is looking for a way to improve and expand her business more. She will share this loan with her loan group, Bless, which has five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another poultry business in another place.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Saumu has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mukony

texts.en:
Mukony is 35 years old, married to Normeshuki and the father of four children. For the last 6 years, he has farmed his own piece of land. He earns a good income through potato farming, which has proven to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

Mukony learned about KADET through posters. This will be his fourth loan of KES 60,000 after successfully paying his previous loans. He plans to buy farm inputs including sprays, pesticides and manure. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of potatoes.

His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more potatoes for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kutaisi with her mother and brother. Several times, Natia has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.Natia’s father lives and works abroad to send his family money for food. His small, unstable money transfers are the only source of income for the family. 

Natia requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's vulnerable poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Natia will purchase clothes in Turkey at wholesale prices and resell them in her community for a profit. It will be hard work for Natia, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Mr. Abdul is a 45-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2005, Abdul has been running his own general store near his house. He sells daily usage products in the store. 

He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his store including powdered milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, candies, etc., but due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will help him offer a good and hygienic variety to his customers. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, candies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, aged 37, she is a responsible mother and lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her 1st loan with BRAC, She is a new member and has agreed to the terms and condition of BRAC.

She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all the household expenses with a low income. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He purchases scrap from the residents in his town, and sells it to companies for recycling. He has been running his business for many years, his shop is located near his home.

Recently, he got a huge contract to buy scrap and useless iron, from a firm. However, he does not have sufficient savings to show his consent to the dealer. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan, so he can buy scrap iron, establish his enterprise and make some savings to meet emergencies. Shazia is very impressed with this honorable support and she hopes to borrow a larger loan after this one. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy recycled material such scrap iron, plastic and aluminum etc for resale.

loans.name: Roern

texts.en:
Roen, 58, lives with her husband and seven children in a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting corn. Having been in this business for twenty years, she is able to earn about 28,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. Roen has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely repaid the previous loans to improve her livelihood.

Now she is requesting a new loan of 1,000,000KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 59 year old married woman. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and 3 grandchildren in Zugdidi district. Mzia works in the local nut factory, where they recycle and package nuts for sale. She has a small monthly salary. Her husband is a worker in the beer company and gets a small monthly salary. Being a refuge, their son gets pension from the government institutions.

As the income is not enough to feed such a large family and cover everyday costs, Mzia decided to start her own business and seek credit among local financial institutions. However, her attempts were unsuccessful because of their poor living conditions. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan, for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $300. With the loan, she will purchase stock of clothing from the wholesalers and then resell it at higher price. This will increase their amily's income. With support of the Startup program Mzia will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and address her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing for resale

loans.name: Miski Ñawi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MISKI ÑAWI”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lizet es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: pensión de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de golosinas, venta de condimentos, venta de chompas y dulces, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lizet es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación su madre que es socia de la institución y le comento de la forma de trabajo que se realiza. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pensión familiar (comida); este negocio lo inicio por el concejo de su madre y con el apoyo de ella hace doce años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el mejoramiento de su negocio (compra de refrigerador) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The MISKI ÑAWI communal bank is beginning its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana center.  It's made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors, where Lizet serves as the Treasurer. The members have different businesses, such as food, blanket making, snack sales, condiment sales, sweater and candy, and fruit sales.

This loan will help their small businesses, including Lizet's.  She says that she has been with Pro Mujer for six months and joined on her mother's invitation, who is also a member.  She currently has a food business and started it with her mother and her support twelve years ago.

This loan will help her improve her business (buy a refrigerator).  She will buy it in one of the El Alto stores and then install it in her store.  This work will allow her to generate income, since she has a son and is a single mother.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda is 37 years old and the mother of four children. She lives with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Farkhanda is taking loan for her husband, who has been manufacturing plastic spare parts through compression molding machines. He has three molding machines. He has appointed two workers on daily wages for manufacturing spare parts. A few days ago one of these molding machines went out of order due to overheating. In fact, the molding machine contains a heater inside which sparked due to fluctuation in electricity. This machine sustained extraordinary damage which is unable to be repaired. 

Her husband wants to buy new compression molding machine to continue his business. He has to complete his tasks on specific given time schedule, but he would be unable to complete it in the absence of a machine. Therefore, Farkhanda contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and presented her humble request for a loan. A field officer has checked out his previous behavior, which is admirable, and then gave approval for the loan. 

Farkhanda seems very happy after taking this loan. She says thanks to Kiva and hopes that lenders will take an active part in supporting her.

loans.use: To buy compression molding machine for manufacturing spare parts.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход трудолюбивый и целеустремленный молодой человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Фарход более 5 лет занимается скотоводством. Он в основном занимается откармливанием крупно - рогатого скота. Он имеет коровник у себя дома и все условия для развития своего бизнеса. Фарход живет в сельской местности и поэтому ему легко развевать свой бизнес. Фарход очень добрый человек. Он всегда помогает всем людям. Его близкий друг не имеет место работы и поэтому планирует уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Он имеет большую семью и живет очень бедно. Фарход решил помочь другу по покупки авиабилета, так как его друг не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Farhod is a hardworking and ambitious young man.  He is married and has two children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for more than five years, and essentially fattens cattle.  He has a barn at home and everything he needs to develop his farming business.  He lives in a rural area which makes it easy to develop such a business.  

Farhod is a very kind man who is always eager to help.  His closest friend is currently unemployed and planning to leave for Russia.  This friend is very poor, with a large family.  Since his friend doesn't have enough money to buy his own ticket, Farhod has decided to help him by buying him a plane ticket.

Farhod is therefore taking a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy a plane ticket.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for his friend who is planning to go to Russia.

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es:
Ana, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar en su tienda; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar productos de la canasta básica, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, papas, golosinas, bebidas, detergentes, entre otros.
La Sra. Ana comenta que el crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar su negocio y asimismo su clientela junto con las ventas. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y desea adquirir una mayor estabilidad económica  en su familia.
texts.en: Ana needs a new loan because she needs capital to buy food products such as beans, rice, sugar, potatoes, snacks, drinks, detergents, and other things.  Ana says that the previous loan helped her improve her business and sales.  Her financial conditions have improved and she wants more financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Vanice

texts.en:
Vanice is an old client of the institution. She is a widow and has three children. Together they reside in Ntungamo district. She is facing a challenge of low working capital in her bar, and she goes on to say that due to the financial problems she is unable to take good care of her family. 

Her prime target is to give her children a better education and to help her extended family. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more drinks for her bar. With this loan, she hopes she can improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her pub

loans.name: José Germán

texts.es:
José, se a dedicado desde muy pequeño a la agricultura teniendo una familia bastante numerosa tenia que desempeñar esa labor, la condición económica de su familia, era bastante mala tenían que dedicase a trabajar y ayudar a sus padres y no logro  ningún grado académico y no pudo lograr aprender a leer ni escribir.
A sus 20 años se caso y empezó a trabajar ya por su cuenta,  en compañía de su esposa, de esta unión procrearon 4 hijos ya  han formado su propia familia.

También se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas, las cuales las cultiva en épocas de verano en una zona de riego, para esta ultima actividad tiene que levantarse bastante temprano; ya que se encuentra a 10 kilómetros de su casa y tiene que estar muy pendiente de ella,  quedándose todo el día si es posible en la noche para cuidarlos de las plagas y animales que llegan por las noches, para el cultivo del maíz lo hace mas cerca a un kilómetro de su casa; ya que a podido conseguir tierras rentando, para terminar temprano tiene que madrugar y en ocasiones hace el día completo, con el se involucran 2 de sus hijos quienes le ayudan a trabajar parte de las tierras

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo de 14, 000 metros cuadrados de maíz, se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz y lograr al final de la cosecha una mayor producción.

 Manifestó, que para un futuro espera terminar de construir su casa y seguir trabajando y ayudar en lo que pueda a sus hijos sacando créditos siempre para el trabajo y utilizando las ganancias para terminar la casa.
texts.en:
José has worked in agriculture since he was quite young, coming from a large family who did the same. His family's economic situation was poor so he had to work to help his parents. He did not go to school and did not learn to read nor write. He married when he was 20 years old and along with his wife began to work for himself. This union produced four children and they formed their own family. 

He grows vegetables on irrigated land in the summer. He has to get up quite early to do this as this plot is 10 kilometers from his house.  He has to keep close watch on it, staying there all day and if possible in the night too, in order to protect it from infestations and animals that come at night. He grows his corn closer to his home, one kilometer away. As he has also managed to rent land, he has to start very early and sometimes work all day. He also has two of his sons who help him work part of the land.

José will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies to buy fertilizer and manure, to pay for labor and to prepare the land to cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn. He plans to care for corn more in order to produce a more plentiful harvest. He says that in the future he wants to finish building his house, continue working and help his sons get more loans to work the land and use the revenues to complete the house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure, to pay for labor and to prepare the land to cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is a 20 years old married lady. She is newly married but her husband does not have a suitable occupation to afford the expense of a single family. Her husband newly started a business. He provides services to wash dirty and dusty carpets. He uses various very costly chemicals to wash the carpets.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient amount to buy these chemicals. One member of BRAC who lives in her neighborhood suggested and referred them to take a loan from BRAC.

Fazeelat wants to financially help her husband in the form of a loan. Therefore, Fazeelat reached the nearest branch of BRAC and requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

The condition of her house is not good, she wants to maintain her house through the profit amount.
  
She hopes that her husband will utilize this loan in a positive way and can establish his business soon. 
Fazeelat says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for washing carpets.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silvia de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta  6º grado, esta acompañada, su compañero de vida es panificador, de sus 3 hijas  solo viven 2 con ella, y solo una de ellas estudia, y la otra le ayuda en el negocio.

Ella posee una panadería, donde elaboran, pan francés y pan dulce. Tiene un año de estar trabajando, en su propio negocio. sin embargo, tiene 23 años de experiencia en el trabajo de panadería, oficio que aprendió de 14 años, cuando se acercó a laborar, pero en el área de embolsado de dicho producto, y con el paso de los días, le dieron la oportunidad de aprender el proceso de elaboración. Ella trabaja en su casa, ahí tiene el negocio, y se involucran en el trabajo su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar un cilindro, equipo que es muy importante, porque este, tiene la función de pulir la maza para elaborar el pan francés y el pan dulce. Ya que anteriormente lo ha hecho de forma artesanal, pero, el francés queda muy reducido de tamaño y con el cilindro, el pan francés quedara de mayor tamaño, y tendrá más aceptación de sus clientes.

Lo que desea es crecer en el negocio de la panadería, así tener más producción, todo eso lo lograra invirtiendo las ganancias, en el negocio. También desea que su hija se prepare profesionalmente, y quisiera remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silvia is 37 years old and she completed school through the 6th grade.  She is married and her husband is a baker.  Of their three children, only two live with her and only one of those attends school.  The other is helping with the family business.

She owns a bakery where she makes French bread and pan dulce (traditional sweet bread in Latin America).  She has worked for the past year in her own business.  However, she also has 23 years of experience working in a bakery.  She learned about bakeries when she was 14 years old and began working.  She started by packaging the breads and with the passing of time she had the opportunity to learn the process of bread making.  She works in her home (where she also runs her business) and she works with the help of her husband and their two daughters.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy a cylinder which is equipment that is very important because it helps prepare the French bread and pan dulce. Previously she had made her bread by hand but the French bread shrinks when it's made.  With a cylinder it can maintain a larger size and her customers prefer larger sized breads.

Her dream is to grow her bakery business and increase production.  She can do this by reinvesting her income into the business.  She also dreams that her daughter will one day become a professional and that she can also one day remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy a cylinder - equipment that is very important in making French bread.

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru: Сироджиддин человек с жизненным опытом. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 8 лет опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов на местном рынке. В последнее время у него мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и он не может придерживать своих клиентов. Сироджиддин должен срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы вернуть своих клиентов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для того, чтобы купить сухофруктов для пополнения оборотного капитала. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sirojiddin is a man with a large experience of life.  He is married and the father of three children.  He is also very hardworking and has more than eight years of experience in his business.
