She anticipates getting profits, which she will use to repay the loan and pay school fees as well as meeting other family needs (i.e purchasing foodstuffs for the family). Her dream is to expand her business in order to generate profits to meet her family's financial needs and educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is from Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 51 years old, married and has two children. 

To make a living, Mila owns and operates a business serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Her husband is a farmer, their main source of income. In 2009, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used as additional capital to improved her business 

Mila is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients and drinks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and drinks.

loans.name: Protea Group

texts.en:
THERESIA, who is in her late 40s, is married with five children who are grown-ups. She has been operating two businesses, selling fruits and vegetables as well as dresses. She has been in this business since 2000. She works from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be THERESIA's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling dresses and to restock items in her fruits and vegetable business. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay for food and household expenses. She will use this loan to  buy more fruits and vegetables as well as dresses and to start selling rice and sugar. She dreams of opening a big shop where she can sell the same items.

THERESIA will share this loan with her loan group, "PROTEA," which includes nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables and dresses and to start selling rice and sugar.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Altantuya is 48 years old lives with her husband in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband Bayasgalan is 49 years old and partly lost his ability to work and stays home. Her father lives in another ger on their plot of land. She has been providing her tailoring business at home for more than a decade and has a lot of experience and regular clients. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Mongolian tugrik (MNT) to purchase a crisscross sewing machine and pay some family expenses. She is a hardworking, diligent and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase a crisscross sewing machine and pay some family expenses

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is married with two children. The family manufactures lampakanay products to earn a living. (Lampakanay is a semi-aquatic herb with durable fibers extracted to make various products.) Her husband also works as a carpenter, but that job is irregular in nature so they focus much attention on developing this business. From this plant, Guadalupe and her family create various ropes, mats, braided furniture and many other products. 

Guadalupe joined GDMPC and has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to expand her business. She is currently requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional raw materials to fulfill orders that are to be completed soon. In the future, she wants to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran lives in Gyumri town with his parents and sister. Tigran's father went to a neighbouring country to find a well paid job and to support his family financially. As the head of the family, Tigran feels responsible for giving his sister and mother appropriate living conditions. Since 2006, Tigran has been selling souvenirs in one of the city markets. Because of financial hardships Tigran is not able to purchase new stock and sell it to his customers. He has therefore applied for this loan. 

Tigran has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Tigran to be able to continue his souvenir-selling business and to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of souvenirs to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Zarifa is a single woman with a son who is 31 years old. She is active in buying and selling seasonal fruits. She purchases goods by the sack or basket from producers. Then she resells her goods to customers at the local bazaar. With her new loan, she intends to purchase fruits and vegetables. The profits will enable her to help meet her family's needs related to health care.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en: Waad is 21 years old. She lives with her parents and five siblings in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. She is currently studying to earn a bachelor's degree of x-ray technology and is in her second year. She has been facing an obstacle of finding some subjects difficult. Waad's father is retired and on a limited budget. For this reason, Waad requires help to pay her semester fees and has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 30 years old. She lives in a small village in the Kakheti region of East Georgia with her husband, parents and two school-age children. Lela’s father is the only one who earns money in the household. He is a furniture-maker and sells his products in the different villages. 

As the existing income is hardly enough for the family members, Lela has requested credit to start up a pig farm. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which provides businesses with start-up credits with soft conditions. This is important for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. 

With the received credit, Lela will start a pig farm. She will purchase five pigs and feed for them. After five or six months, Lela will have piglets for sale. She will sell the piglets in the village as well as at the local open market. The family will sell on average 45 piglets per year. The income of the family will increase by 300 to 400 GEL per month, which will result in a 75- to 100-percent increase in income. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and, in the future, they will have enough income to access regular credit products that are available on the country’s capital market. This will enable them to further expand the family farm.

loans.use: to purchase five pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is 19 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbed with his parents and four siblings. Eyad is currently studying in his second year for his Bachelor of Pharmacy degree. He also sells clothes in the evening. Eyad's goal is to find a job in his field of study after graduation to earn a better income. His mother is a retired woman and works as a hairdresser and his father is a retired man with his own workshop. But they are not earning enough income to help him cover his semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is a 39-year-old married man from the small village of Chkhorotsku district. He lives with his wife, six children, daughter-in-law, brother and parents. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. He has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood, as his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Kakha was unable to study a professional career.  Kakha works hard and runs an animal husbandry business. In particular, they have two milking cows, three calves, two pigs and a horse. Kakha’s wife milks the cows everyday and produces dairy products to sell. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price.  As the family has only a seasonal income, Kakha decided to start an additional business and seek credit from local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan to start or re-start businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $1300. With the loan, he will purchase a car and serve the local people as a taxi driver. This will increase their income and he will be able to improve the living conditions of such a large family.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a widow with three children and lives in Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She runs a sari-sari store selling home use products in their community to earn a living. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and biscuits for sale. She saves a portion of her income in preparation for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and biscuits for sale

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Kuña Mbarete esta escrito en el idioma guaraní, y quiere decir mujer fuerte, ya que las integrantes de este grupo es lo que son. Ellas están en su Cuarto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de las 15 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una persona digna de destacar es Noelia, quien tiene una pequeña despensa, ella con su esfuerzo y dedicación pudo montar su negocio, y hoy en día ya es muy conocida y tiene muy buena clientela. Es una persona que desde siempre ha trabajado y no teme a seguir haciéndolo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de comestibles, bebidas, verduras, y demás, y con ello seguir dando a su clientela lo que pide, y ella podrá seguir aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Kuña Mbarete is a guaraní word that means ”strong woman,” something this group’s members are. They are now in their fourth cycle of the women committee program. All of them are committed to work and help each other get ahead. They took part in the Poverty Elimination Survey; four out of fifteen were found to live below the poverty line.

Noelia is an outstanding person. She has a small grocery store. She opened it with a lot of effort and dedication and she is today well known and has a good customer base. She is a person that has always worked and is not afraid to continue doing so.

Noelia is requesting a loan to buy food products, beverages, vegetables, etc. and continue to offer what her customers need. This way, she will continue to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy food products, beverages, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El señor Angel, es una persona de 50 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Tiraque, tiene 3 dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos, la actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura de tal forma produce;   Papa 80 cargas, Haba (verde)  120 cargas, Zanahoria 400 cargas. La siembra de estos cultivos los realiza en sus terrenos propios en una superficie de 3 Hectáreas que están ubicados en la misma comunidad donde vive, los trabajos agrícolas los realiza con la colaboración  de sus vecinos, y con la colaboración de trabajadores eventuales donde cancela por jornal trabajado Bs 50 vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo comprara  semilla de papa, para que de esta forma tenga mejores ingresos  y de igual manera mejore su calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Angel is 50 years old and single. He was able to go to primary school. He lives in his own house in the community of Tiraque. He has 3 dependents under his responsibility, his children. His main activity is farming. He produces 80 loans of potatoes 120 loads of (green) beans), and 400 loads of carrots. He grows these crops on his own land on a surface of 3 hectares, located in the same community where he lives.He does the farm work with his neighbors' help and with the help of temporary workers, whom he pays 50 Bs a day. He lives in a rustic house made of adobe. With the loan, he will buy potato seeds so that he can have better income and improve the quality of life of his dependents.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Gonzalo, es una persona de 36 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Tiraque, tiene 6 dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos, la actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura de tal forma produce;   Papa 110 cargas, Haba (verde)  28 cargas, Cebolla 25 k'epis, Trigo 16 quintales, Cebada 18 quintales y Avena (forrajera) 2 camiones. La siembra de estos cultivos los realiza en sus terrenos propios heredados de su padre que están ubicados en la misma localidad, los trabajos agrícolas los realiza con la colaboración  de sus vecinos, vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo que realiza es para  comprar abono de gallinaza y de esta manera tendrá una mejor cosecha que le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones económicos y por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Gonzalo is 36 years old and single. He was able to go to primary school. He lives in his own home in the community of Tiraque. He has 6 dependents under his responsibility, his children. His main activity is farming. He produces potatoes, 110 loads, beans (greens), 28 loads, onions, 25 loads, wheat, 16 quintals, barley, 18 quintals, and oats (fodder), 2 truckloads. He grows these crops on his own land inherited from his father. They are located in the same area. He does his farm work with the help of his neighbors and lives in a rustic adobe house. This loan is to buy chicken manure fertilizer. This way, he will have a better harvest that will allow him to improve his financial conditions and therefore his dependents' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken manure fertilizer

loans.name: Chnar's Group

texts.en:
Chnar is a member of this group from Iraq. Chnar is 36 years old, married and has two children. She is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate additional income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has seven years of experience with her home-based sewing business activity. To improve the quality of the services to her customers as well as improve her work conditions she would like to buy new sewing machine, table, iron and fabric.

Chnar has a very good reputation in her neighborhood, with her special talent and the customer service she provides. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she can sell her products wholesale in the market and continue assisting her husband with additional income and providing a better life for her children.

The story of Chnar and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients who have been able to improve their businesses with a small business loan product specifically designed to meet the needs of a small business where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, table, iron and fabric.

loans.name: Jabir

texts.en:
Jabir is a 41-year-old married man and a father of four children. He has been working in the agriculture sector for eight years. Jabir is specialized in growing palm trees and selling dates.

Jabir takes good care of his farm and production to ensure his palm trees stay healthy and yield high-quality products. Jabir is requesting a loan to purchase organic fertilizers and a water pump. Jabir expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to buy livestock and develop his farm to give his family a good life.

The story of Jabir and his palm farm is just one of the many examples of clients of Izdiharona for Economic Development who have been able to improve their businesses with a small business loan product specifically designed to meet the needs of a small business where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers and a water pump.

loans.name: Oscar Alfredo

texts.es: Oscar, a sus 22 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, debido a que desde que era niño aprendió las labores agrícolas mientras veía trabajar a sus padres que siempre se han dedicado a esta labor. Gracias a esto, hoy en día posee sus propios cultivos y en época de cosecha, recolecta y vende los productos en la plaza de mercado de la vereda donde reside, de esta forma genera ingresos que le permiten aportar a la economía de su hogar. El cliente es un joven activo, emprendedor, dedicado a su labor. Solicita el crédito con el interés de invertirlo en la compra de los insumos agrícolas (abonos, semillas, pesticidas, fertilizantes), que son necesarios para darle continuidad a su negocio, con ellos podrá cuidar la tierra y prepararla para la temporada de cosecha, en la que espera recolectar productos de muy buena calidad para ser vendidos a mejor precio en el mercado. Oscar sueña con hacer de sus cultivos un negocio rentable, que le dé la oportunidad de seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y que le garantice una estabilidad favorable, para compartir con sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 22 years old and a farmer.  He learned when he was a boy, having watched his parents who have always done this kind of work.

Thanks to this he now has his own crops which he collects and sells in the local market during the harvest season.  In this way he generates income to support his home.

He is an active, enterprising young man, dedicated to his work.  He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies (compost, seeds, pesticides, fertilizers) that he needs to continue his business.  He will be able to care for the soil and prepare it for the harvest season, when he expects to collect good quality products he can sell in the market.

Oscar dreams of making his crops a profitable business so he can continue to support his family financially and guarantee them stability so he can share a better quality of life with his parents.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
Zakia is a member of this group from Iraq. Zakia is 47 years old. She is a widow and has one child. She is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate additional income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has ten years of experience with her home-based sewing business activity and to improve the quality of the services to her customers as well as improve her work conditions, she would like to buy a new sewing machine, an iron and fabric.

Zakia has a very good reputation in her neighborhood, with her special talent and the customer service she provides. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits by selling to wholesalers in addition to customers in her neighbourhood. She also wants to continue providing a good life for her child with the additional income .

The story of Zakia and her sewing business is just one of the many examples from Izdiharona for Economic Development where clients have been able to improve their businesses with a small business loan product specifically designed to meet the needs of a small business where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, an iron and fabric.

loans.name: Turad

texts.en:
Turad is 26 years old. He lives with his mother and brother in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Turad is currently studying for a Bachelors of Extent Engineering and is in the 2nd year. He also works as a personal driver for students. His brother is also a student. 

Turad is depending on himself financially and is trying to support his family. But his income is not enough to cover the fees for his studies. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his two sons and father. Ashot's father has a retirement pension and doesn't work so Ashot is the only breadwinner of the family. He earns his living by selling firewood and other wood products to locals. He works hard to sell more and gather enough income for his family. Now, Ashot needs financial support to increase his working capital and organize sales. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important in order for Ashot to be able to continue his wood-selling business and improve his family's living conditions. He hopes for lenders’ support.

loans.use: to purchase wood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 43-year-old farmer from the village of Abanoeti. She is married and lives with her husband and two school-age children. Manana grows walnuts and grapes on the family-owned agricultural land. The harvest is sold at the local open market. In addition, the family breeds pig and produces ham to sell.

Manana’s husband works as a diesel generator specialist and gets a small monthly income. Their existing revenues are hardly enough for food and everyday costs. That is why the family decided to start their own business. Manana applied for credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the vulnerable poor to start or restart businesses. 

A loan of 3,500 GEL will help her to purchase a minibus. Once the minibus is purchased, her husband will work on the minibus and transport the passengers from one district to another. This business initiative will generate an income. With the increased income, the family members will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Al Loaloaa 2 Group

texts.en:
Randa is the featured borrower of the Al Loaloaa 2 group. She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

For 25 years, Randa has worked doing embroidery from her house. She is very talented in her domain with a very good reputation in her region. Randa is a 54-year-old single lady, who puts a lot of effort into developing her business and improving her living conditions. She is the lady wearing the black shirt. 

Her loan will be invested in buying special threads from the newly released collection and other requested items needed to develop her business. 

As for the other group members, Ettihad is the lady with blue shirt and Joumana is wearing white and is standing in the middle.

loans.use: To buy special threads needed to develop her business.

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is 21 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbed with his parents and four siblings. One of his brothers works as a painter. Abdulaziz is currently studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration and is in the third year. He is planning to continue his studies to get a Master's degree. 

He is currently facing financial problems which mean he is not able to pay for his semester fees and for the other tools and books that he needs. For that reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 24 years old, a farmer and a baker, and single. Daniel has been farming and baking for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES 2800. He uses his income for his upkeep and that of his parents. 

Daniel is applying for his first loan with KADET. He will use the loan to purchase baking flour, oil and firewood. 

With the expected profit from his business, he will engage in large-scale farming. His hopes and dreams are to buy a motorbike in future, and to have his own family.

loans.use: To purchase baking flour, oil and firewood for his baking business

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 27 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store. He established his business with a small amount of capital. Most of the people who visit the store know Ahmed, because he always has what his customers need at affordable prices and with good quality. He is a visionary, always searching for ways to succeed and remain active, to be able to reach his future goals.  

It’s here that he decided to request a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to buy grocery items to sell at his store, like sugar, beans, eggs and soft drinks. With his aim to increase his earnings, he is certain that he will be able to give his family a good life this way.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell at his store, like sugar, beans, eggs and soft drinks.

loans.name: Séna

texts.fr: Mariée à un instituteur et mère de famille, madame Séna est âgée de 38ans. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle vend depuis 08ans des pagnes, des tissus, des chaussures, des sacs  dans une boutique. Ses produits sont de bonnes qualités et elle est sollicitée de part et d’autres de la ville de Lomé. Elle veut acheter des variétés de marchandises et sollicite un autre crédit pour acheter des pagnes, des tissus, des chaussures et sacs. Avec les profits, elle voudrait louer une autre boutique, elle espère assurer l’avenir de la famille.
texts.en: Married to a teacher, Séna is 38 years old and a mother. To help her husband with the household expenses, she has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), fabric, shoes, and handbags in a shop for the last 8 years. Her products are high quality and she is sought after from other parts of the city of Lomé. She wants to purchase a variety of merchandise and is requesting another loan to purchase 'pagnes,' fabric, shoes, and handbags.With the profits, she wants to open another shop, and hopes to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth, fabrics, shoes, jewelry, and bags

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 43 years old and married to Stanley. They have been blessed with four children, aged 20 and 9 years, both of whom they support and provide for. Prisca is in a cereals selling business in Itigo, Nandi County, a location that is served by KADET's Kapsabet office. Cereals selling has been her income-generating business for the past ten years. She earns an average monthly income of KES 20,000.

She plans to use the amount borrowed, KES 100,000, to purchase more cereals for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to meet her family's financial needs and expand her business. Her dreams are to expand her business, and have a cereals packaging firm in future.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Saidakhon

texts.ru: Саидахон добросовестная женщина. Ей 28 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями и братом. Саидахон после окончания средней школы поступила в Технологический Колледж и успешно окончила. Несколько лет она занималась шитьем женской одежды дома. С 2013 года она работает в штабе. Она умная и начитанная женщина и всегда стремиться к новшеству. Она хочет получить высшее образование. С такой целью она поступила в университет. Ее отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и поэтому не может поддержать свою дочь. Саидахон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saidakhon is a conscientious woman. She is 28, single, and lives with her parents and brother. After graduating from high school, Saidakhon went to the technical college and graduated. For several years she worked at making women's clothing. Since 2013 she has been working in an office. She is a smart and well-read woman, and she always tries to be innovative. She wants to get a college degree, and thus has entered the university. Her father is a migrant worker in Russia and is unable to support his daughter. Saidakhon is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for her college tuition

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 57-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband earns insufficient income to support his family, alone. Sughran is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family.

Because she wants to grow her business, Sughran requested a loan of PKR 25,000. She will use the loan to buy a stock of rice, flour and sugar from the market, at lower rates. Then she would be able to meet the increasing demand, consistently. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses, and the rest to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Amrullo

texts.ru: Амрулло родился в 1995 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он с детства мечтал быть экономистом как его отец. Он отлично учился в средней школе. Активно участвовал во всех мероприятиях школы. Амрулло успешно окончил в этом году среднюю школу. Он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Таджикистана Политики и Бизнеса. Он поступил по специальности экономиста. Амрулло надеется учиться хорошо в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора.
texts.en: Amrullo was born in 1995, is single and lives with his parents. He has long dreamed of becoming an economist, like his father. He was an excellent student in high school, and actively participated in all school activities. This year he graduated successfully and has been accepted at the Tadjik State University of Tajik Politics and Business, majoring in economics. He hopes to be successful at the university, and is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition.

loans.use: To pay for for his college tuition

loans.name: Ehtimad Group

texts.en:
Leila is the featured borrower of Ehtimad Group. She got together with the other two group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Leila is a 60-year-old, married mother of three children. She has been working in preparing food at her house and selling it upon customers' requests (a catering business) for six years. She helps her husband in making their living and covering most of their children's needs. Leila is acquiring a loan, to buy necessary raw ingredients for her business development, which will help her to increase her production, and to respond easily to increasing requests. In the photo, she is the lady with red shirt.

As for the other group members, Mouna is wearing a green shirt and Zahra is the lady standing in the middle.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw ingredients for her catering business's growth

loans.name: Maria Evangelina

texts.es:
Maria vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, es madre de 2 hijos de 18 y 21 años, a quienes quiere mucho y a quienes ha sacado adelante sola con mucho esfuerzo. Mari trabaja como empleada en un hotel de su ciudad y también trabaja como empleada en un camal de su ciudad. Con los ingresos de sus trabajos puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo, ya que trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar los gastos de estudio de su hijo como materiales de estudio, de esta manera su hijo tendrá los implementos necesarios para estudiar y Maria podrá seguir luchando por hacer su sueño realidad:” darle a sus hijos una buena educación”.
texts.en: María lives in the town of Huaraz. She is a mother of two: her children are 18 and 21 years old, and she loves them very dearly after taking great pains to raise them on her own. She works as an employee in a hotel in her town and has a second job at a slaughterhouse. Thanks to the income these jobs provide, she is able to pay for household expenses, but it implies a great deal of effort, since she works about ten hours a day. María is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, she will be able to pay for her son's school-related expenses, such as books and supplies. This way, her son will have the tools to keep studying and María can keep fighting to make her dream come true: "I want my children to have a good education".

loans.use: to pay for school-related expenses.

loans.name: Aygul

texts.ru: Айгул 45 лет, замужем, вдова, одна воспитывает 2 детей. У Айгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 26 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 8 овец, 5 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и в будущем планирует накопить средства на покупку квартиры.
texts.en: Aigul is a 55 year-old widow, and is raising 2 children by herself. She has a high school diploma. As the only source of support for her family, she raises livestock. She started 26 years ago, buying some animals for 4000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aigul's hard work, her farm now has 1 dairy cow, 1 calf, 8 sheep, and 5 goats. Her monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). With the goal of expanding her business, Aigul has turned to the Bai-Tushum & Partners microlending bank for a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. She plans on using the proceeds from the loan to further increase the size of her livestock herd, and in the future plans to save some money to buy an apartment.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: Don José de 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 9 años, además se dedica a cuidar un rancho, es una persona responsable, trabajadora, y con una excelente moral, sus cosechas tienen mucha demanda en la zona y en sus alrededores, gracias a sus labores ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos,  don José solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz como:  semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. asi como muestra la fotografia y así poder obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: José is 33 years old. He lives in his own house alongside his partner and their son. He has been dedicated to cultivating maize for nine years in addition to taking care of a ranch. He is a responsible and hard working person with excellent morals. His harvests have a lot of demand in the area and its surrounding areas. Thanks to his efforts, he has managed to pay off some of his expenses. José  is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs to sow maize like seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, etc. as the photograph shows and also to be able to obtain better earnings and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Rosa America

texts.es: Doña rosa de 35  años de edad es madre soltera  vive  en casa propia  junto a sus dos hijos  quienes estudian actualmente,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y todo tipo de juguetes desde hace varios años  es una persona muy trabajadora  responsable  y honesta  además muy amable con sus clientes  lo que la ha llevado a conseguir una gran clientela  que demandan sus productos  de esta manera ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos  ahora ella solicita un crédito  paras la compra de mas mercadería por mayor  para poder abastecer aun mas  su negocio  e incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 35 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her two children, who are currently studying. Rosa has been selling clothing, cosmetics and all types of toys for many years now. She is a very hardworking, responsible and honest person and is very friendly to her customers, which has helped her to build a large customer base and demand for her products. With this work she has been able to meet some of her bills. 

Rosa is now requesting a loan to buy more merchandise in bulk to re-stock her store, increase her earnings and improve both her and her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and all types of toys in bulk

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is from Goris town, where he lives together with his wife. The couple earns a living by selling different kinds of products (clothing, home products, and food) to local people and neighboring communities. Vardan purchases new products from Yerevan and then sells them locally. Demand is high in the communities near Goris for the products that Vardan and his wife sell, because there are not many shops. So they work really hard to meet customer demand and earn income for their living.

Now, for purchasing new supplies of products to sell, Vardan needs financial support. He has applied and been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to other credit products. The loan is very important, for Vardan to be able to increase the supply of products he has available for sale to customers and to be able to improve the living conditions for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for new supplies of products to sell to customers

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es:
Mario tiene 23 años de edad, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, Mario trabaja como asistente en un fundo de su ciudad, y con el fruto de sus ingresos puede solventar sus gastos y apoyar a su familia, el es muy responsable y por ello cree que esta saliendo adelante.

Mario está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, en especial en su habitación ya que presenta varias rajaduras, y va poder adquirir una cama en buenas condiciones, ya que la que tiene actualmente esta rota de esta manera tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en: Mario, 23, is a young man with strong ambitions to make something of himself. Mario works as an assistant on a farm in his town, and with the money he makes he is able to pay the household expenses and support his family. He is very responsible and believes that is the reason he is getting ahead in life. Mario is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to their help he will be able to carry out some home improvements, in particular fixing some cracks in his bedroom. He will also be able to get a bed in good condition, as the one he currently has is broken. This will give him a better quality of life and enable him to keep fighting to make his ultimate dream of having his own house a reality.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 53 años de edad, vive  en casa propia con su esposo y  sus dos hijos, hace 22 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos y pescados, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Rosa solicita un crédito para la compra de mariscos y pescados por mayor ya que cada  vez se acerca más la temporada que tiene más demanda, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children. She has been selling shellfish and fish for the last 22 years and she has been able to meet some of the household costs with her income from this work.

Rosa is applying for a loan to purchase shellfish and fish in bulk since it is getting closer and closer to the season where there is more demand for them. With this loan Rosa hopes to be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy propane gas tanks at wholesale.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 38 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She is the mother of three children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past two and one-half years. She is zealous about her work, and customer demand is strong.  Safia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is also involved in the work of cloth sales, to generate an extra amount of income.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000. She will use the loan to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls, in large quantities. These supplies will enable her to complete the orders of her customers on time.  She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in large quantities, such as thread, sequins and pearls

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years old, married to Amos, and blessed with two children, age 16 and 10 years. 

She sells milk and grocery goods, a business she ventured into five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 10,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables and milk for sale. The profit from her business will help her purchase a piece of land. Her dream is to become a renowned dairy farmer in this region who will be able to supply people with milk.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables and milk.

loans.name: Sarfaraz

texts.en:
Sarfaraz is a 36-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000, which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose tiene 62 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y trabaja en su pequeño negocio de mecánica de autos, Jose le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día, el  cree que le está yendo bien en su negocio porque es responsable y cumplido con sus clientes.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que  gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una maquina soldadora, la cual le ayudara mucho en su negocio y así poder atender mejor a sus cliente y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Crecer y ser un gran microempresario”.
texts.en:
Jose is 62 years old. He lives in the city of Ica and works in his small auto mechanic business. Jose dedicates himself to his business for around 8 hours a day and he can attend to up to ten customers a day. He believes that his business is going well because he is responsible and courteous with his customers.

Jose is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy a welding machine, which will help him a lot in his business and enable him to attend better to his customers and to continue fighting to be able to make his greatest dream a reality: To grow and to be a great microentrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Morad

texts.en:
Morad is 25 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He earns a livelihood by being involved in a stationery business, which has been in operation for a few years. He did all of the work himself, with no set hours and he had some difficulties to overcome. With the passage of days, he was able to open his own stationery store. Consequently, he decided to take out a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to purchase books, gifts and other stationery items to maintain and satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to purchase books, gifts and other stationery items to maintain and satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca de 43 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su madre,  esposo y  su hijo de 9 años que estudia actualmente, ella se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, es muy conocida en la zona por ser trabajadora, responsable  y dedicada a su negocio , además posee buen comportamiento de pago, de esta manera ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares, doña Francisca solicita un crédito para comprar materia prima para poder seguir elaborando sus productos como:  leche, garrafas de agua, utensilios de cocina, etc. Y así obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca is 43 and lives in her own house with her mother, husband and nine-year-old son, who is currently in school. She works making dairy products and is very well known in the area for being hardworking, responsible and dedicated to her business. She is also reliable with money, and is able to pay for some of the household expenses. Francisca is asking for a loan to buy the basic materials she needs to make her products, such as milk, water tanks and cooking utensils. These will allow her to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk, water tanks and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Silvia Edith

texts.es: Silvia, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Choloma. Cortes. Ella tiene 15 años de tener un negocio de pulpería donde vende granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, azúcar, harina, churros, huevos, especies, refrescos, etc. este negocio lo tiene en su casa y es su fuente de ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras, siendo este el tercer ciclo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos como carnes, refrescos, granos básicos, azúcar, pan, golosinas, embutidos, y otros abarrotes para surtir la pulpería. Ella tiene como meta lograr una estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Silvia is 38 years old. She lives with her common-law partner with whom she has three children. She lives in the town of Choloma Cortes. For 15 years she has had a grocery store business where she sells basic grains, meats, sausages, sugar, flour, churros, eggs, condiments, refreshments, etc. She has this business in her house and it is her fountain of income to help with the home expenses. She has decided to request another loan of 25,000 lempiras, this being her third cycle, which she will invest in the purchase of products like meat, sodas, basic grains, sugar, bread, candies, sausages and other groceries to stock her store. She has a goal of achieving economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase products like meat, sodas, basic grains, sugar, bread, candies, sausages, and other groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 44-year-old, married woman and a mother of five. She has been running a business of clothing sales for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous in her community, for selling good-quality clothes.

Zubaida requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She will use the loan to buy a collection of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she expects to earn more income, through her greater sales. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history.  She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and she wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members, through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a collection of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 60-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and for the past five years, she has been running a business of clothes sales. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Shahnaz is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 47 years old and a married woman. She has been in a beauty parlor business for the past 10 years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers, and she makes enough to contribute in the family income.

She needs to serve more customers, time after time. For this, she requires hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening, all in large quantities. So she applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation.  She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction, as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening, in large quantities.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is a 44-year-old married man. He lives in the Telavi district with his wife and two daughters, who go to school. His wife is the housekeeper. The family is out of a source of income. 

Givi decided to start his own business and sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor and inexperienced rural people to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $950. With the received credit, he will purchase fruits from the wholesalers and then resell them at higher prices. The trading business will enable him to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family. 
The new business initiative will give him a chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: to begin a trade with fruits.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is 43 years old, a married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Ruqia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Ruqia has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Ruqia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Marium

texts.en: Marium had a difficult time after her husband's business failure so she decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Four years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living nearby and uses the income to support her entire family. Due to having limited cash available she is unable to meet the current daily demands of her customers. For this reason she contacted Kashf foundation and has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR. This loan will help her to purchase more spools of thread, packs of needles, elastic and buttons. She is currently in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of needles, elastic and buttons.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, a 21-year-old vigorous lady, has been stitching clothes for many years. Sewing for the people of her community, she uses her income to support her entire family.


A lack of funds prevents Bushra from meeting the daily demands of her customers, so she is requesting her second loan for Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of threads in various colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons. These purchases will enable her to generate a healthier  income. She is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in various colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 24ans, Adjo est mére de 02 enfants(04 et 02ans) et a pour mari un ingénieur. Elle revend depuis 2011 du piment et du mais de façon ambulante. Son second crédit l'aidera à s'approvisionner plus en marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients.  Le profit l'aidera à développer son activité.
texts.en: A young, 24 year old woman, Adjo is the mother of two children who are two and four years old. Her husband is an engineer. She has been selling chili peppers and corn on foot since 2011. Her second loan will help her buy more goods in order to satisfy her clients. The profits will help her develop her business.

loans.use: buy chili peppers and corn.

loans.name: Djémila

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter plus de marchandises, Djémila sollicite un quatrième prêt. Elle revend depuis 2005 des céréales, du piment... dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. Elle est mariée à un maçon et mère de 04 enfants. 3 sont scolarisés. Elle espère épargner une partie et investir le reste dans l'activité.
texts.en: In order to purchase more inventory, Djémila is requesting a fourth loan. She has been in the business of reselling grains and spices since 2005 in a market in the city of Lomé. She is married to a mason and is the mother of 4 children. 3 of her children attend school. Djémila hopes to save a portion of the profits and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase grain and spices

loans.name: Peeno

texts.en:
Peeno is a 33-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She hopes to grow her business and wishes to spend part of profits on the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 58-year-old married mother of two children. She is one of the Palestinian refugees who are living in a Palestinian camp since they were born in Lebanon.

Khadija has worked in selling fruits and vegetables since three years ago. This business is very important for her family's living since her husband doesn't have a stable income job; he depends on others' need for work.

Her business is based at her house. It's part of it, because for now she can't financially afford to open a separate one.

Khadija is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with special season's fruits and vegetables. This loan is very important for her family's living, since she is considered to be the sole breadwinner for three members of her family (including her husband).
  
She hopes that one day she will be capable of opening a separate fruits and vegetables selling shop.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with special season's fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rakhe

texts.en: Rakhe, 47, is a married woman who has run a milk selling business with her husband for 10 years. She has two buffaloes and one cow to milk. By this time, she has become famous for providing good quality milk in her location, and she makes enough to contribute in the family income. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to increase her production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Doña Marta de 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y una hija de 16 años de edad quien estudia actualmente,  ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace mas de 10 años, además posee una tienda en su residencia, es una persona amble, trabajadora  y además es muy emprendedora, lucha por sacar a su familia adelante. Doña Marta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más cerdos, concentrado y vitaminas para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y  de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Marta is 56 years old and lives in her own house together with her life companion and a 16 year old daughter who is currently studying. She raises pigs for a living and has done so for more than 10 years. She also has a store in her home. She is a kind, hardworking person and is very entrepreneurial. She struggles to get her family ahead in life. Marta is requesting a loan to buy pigs, concentrate and vitamins to continue with her work, as it is her only source of income and in this way obtain better income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, concentrate and vitamins.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme KADIATOU debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.  
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 105.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Sinignessigui III are married women with an average age of 40 years and 6 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

The women are partnering with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to further their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the organization, the previous loans having been fully repaid. 

The crop of choice for Kadiatou, pictured standing second from the left in the photo, is corn. With this loan, she plans to purchase labor, seeds, and the supplies to maintain her half hectare.

The harvest is sold at the village in Sikasso after harvesting, to a customer base made up of men and women. Kadiatou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 105,000 francs CFA per field. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: purchase labor, supplies, and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia junto a su hija y  su compañero de vida quien se dedica la albañilería. Ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años, es una persona trabajadora, luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante a su familia, posee muy buenas referencias, la tienda tiene mucha demanda en la zona, ya que no hay mucha competencia y además es una zona muy transitada, gracias a estas ventajas logra obtener muy buenos ingresos, de esta manera y con la ayuda de su esposo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos, la clienta  solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para su tienda como golosinas, sodas, dulces, granos básicos, aceites, café, etc. Y así poder  obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client lives in her own home alongside her daughter and her partner, who works in construction. She has a store which she has had for many years. She is a hardworking and determined person, who wants to move forward with her family. She has good references. The store has a lot of demand in the area, because there is not much competition and it is a well-trafficked zone. Thanks to these advantages, she is able to earn a good income. This way, and with help from her husband, she has been able to pay some of her expenses. The client is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise for her store like candies, sodas, sweets, dry grains, oils, coffee, etc., and this way be able to earn a better income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candies, sodas, sweets, dry grains, oils, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 30 years of age, married to Ambrose, and blessed with four children, age 13,11, 9, and 7. 

She runs a tailoring shop, a business she ventured into 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She wants to purchase an additional sewing machine and has requested a first loan of KES 20,000. The profit from her business will help her pay school fees for her children and repay her loan as well. Her dream is to open up a tailoring school to train young people.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is a 42-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family.

She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last year. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.  

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en: Tanveer is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 44 years old. He is married and has one son. Samvel lives with his family in Kapan. His wife doesn't work and takes care of their household, so Samvel is the only breadwinner of the family. He earns his family's living by providing renovation service to locals. He has been involved in this business for  2 years already and it helps him to cover daily costs and have a stable income. 

Samvel is asking for a loan to buy equipment and be able to provide his renovation services. Samvel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan will assist Samvel to purchase the equipment which will greatly ease his work and he will be able to gain more customers.

loans.use: to pay for equipment for offering renovation services

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer is 42 years old and a married man. He lives with his wife and two children in a small village of Telavi district. His wife is a teacher and works at a local secondary school. Vladimer is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular he has a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. He works hard and has high quality produce which is sold to local retailers for a good price. But as the income is only seasonal and is not enough for everyday expenses, Vladimer decided to get a loan and start his own business. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The start-up program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Vladimer's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $2000. With the received credit he plans to purchase a minibus and start dealing in fruits and vegetables. He will purchase fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of his family. With increased income he will improve living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and start selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fassodemeton Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Fassodèmèton sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Fambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Wassa (1ère femme assise de la droite vers la gauche  dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of Fassodèmèton are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 35 years and 2 children each. The women all live in the village of Fambougou in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali.) They came to know each other through their seasonal farming businesses, as neighbors, by way of marriage and as relatives within the village.

The women of Fassodèmèton farm groundnuts, millet, and rice. With the goal of purchasing small equipment and to stock up on farming supplies, the members of the group partnered with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third farming loan. 

Wassa (the first woman seated from right to left in the photo) plans to use her loan to work her field, purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to pay young laborers to weed her field. The sale of her crops happens at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan and ultimately to have funds to care for her children and her family.

loans.use: purchase small equipment, seeds, and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is 46 years old, married to Zeddy, and both are blessed with nine children. He has been in the motorcycle business for the last three years with the monthly income of KES 35,000. Alexander managed to get an asset loan from KADET LTD of KES 97,400 which he used to get a motorcycle as a means of expanding his business. He will use the anticipated profit to build his own rental houses. His hopes and dreams are to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy a motocycle

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en: Johanna is 56 years old, married to Damaris, and supports a family of five children aged between twenty-five and six years of age. He has been a maize and potatoes farmer for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is servicing a second loan of KES 25,000 from KADET which he intends to use to prepare the land for the planting season as well as to purchase seedlings. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to prepare land for the planting season

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es: Don José de 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia  junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 11 y 9 años de edad  que estudian actualmente, él posee una tienda desde hace mas de 5 años es su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocido en el sector  ya que se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy transitada, es una persona muy responsable, honesta con sus clientes lo que la ha llevado a ganarse su preferencia. Él solicita un crédito para la compra de más productos para su tienda como refrescos, golosinas, granos básicos etc. Y así obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and their two daughters, aged 11 and 9, in the house that he owns. His daughters currently study.  

For more than 5 years now he has operated a store that is located in his home. The store is well known in the area because it is located in a busy area. Jose is very responsible and honest with his clients, which has earned him their preference. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more products for his store such as soft drinks, candies, basic dry grains etc. This will increase his earnings and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candies, basic dry grains etc.

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.es: Doña Juana de 31 años de edad, vive en casa de un familiar  junto a su compañero de vida y con sus dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente, ella se dedica al venta de enchapes y productos de oro, además vende productos por catalogo desde hace mas de 3 años, es una persona con muy buen carácter, honesta y muy dedicada  a sus labores, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares. Doña Juana solicita un crédito para la compra de accesorios de oro para poder surtir mas su negocio como: pulseras, aritos y  cadenas  y así poder satisfacer la demanda que posee, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias para ofrecerle a su familia un mejor futuro económico.
texts.en:
Juana is 31 years old and lives in the house of one of her relatives with her partner and her two children, aged 10 and 6 years of age, who are currently studying. Juana has sold gold and gold plated products from a catalogue for over three years. She is an honest person of good character and is very dedicated to her work, which is how she has been able to meet some of her household costs. 

Juana is applying for a loan to purchase gold accessories such as bracelets, earrings and necklaces with which to re-stock her business. By doing so she will be able to meet current demand and obtain a greater income to create a better future financially for her family.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, earrings and gold plated chains in bulk

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is married and has two children.  He lives in Azatavan village. Nver has been involved in agriculture for five years, but is already very skilled. He runs a farm which includes two pigs and two greenhouses. 

As agriculture provides the main income of the family, the enlargement of the farm is very important for Nver. One of his greenhouses is old and needs to be renovated. Unfortunately, Nver has no financial means to do so. The income he earns barely covers the family's basic needs. Nver is requesting a loan, which he will use to renovate his greenhouse and purchase pigs and forage. The loan will greatly help him to continue his farming business. Nver is sure that his hard work will bring him a profitable farm.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of a greenhouse and purchase pigs and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is 20 years old. She lives with her parents and three brothers in Zarqa, Jordan. Hiba is currently in her third year of studying for her Bachelor of Finance. Her aim is to work in her field after graduation to be able to support herself and her parents. 

Hiba is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay for her semester fees as her parents do not have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Doña María de 53 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia,  la cliente posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años,  es una mujer muy trabajadora  y responsable tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que tiene en su tienda, doña Maria está solicitando un crédito  para la compra de  granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, azúcar, sopas, etc.  y poder generar una mayor  ganancia y mejores ingresos para tener una mejor vida con su esposo.
texts.en: María is 53 and lives with her husband in their own house, where she has run a shop for the last 15 years. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman and she has a lot of customers thanks to the variety of products she sells in her shop. María is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sugar, soap etc., which will allow her to generate a bigger income and have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sugar, soap etc.

loans.name: Corina Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña corina de 55 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres nietos de 19, 18 y 14 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, es comerciante de ropa vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, doña corina está solicitando  el crédito  para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropa por mayor y poder generar  mayores ganancias  y tener una mejor calidad  de vida.
texts.en: Corina is 55 and lives with her husband and three grandchildren aged 19, 18 and 14, who are currently in school. Corina is a very hardworking woman who works selling clothing door to door in the different communities around where she lives. She is asking for a loan to invest in buying wholesale clothing which will allow her to increase her earnings and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing such as skirts, blouses, shirts etc.

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin is 34 years old and married, with a six-year-old son.  The family lives in the littoral city of Batumi, West Georgia. Roin is the only income provider in his household, and he works in a small workshop as a mobile phones mechanic. He works all day long to generate income, but his funds are unstable and hardly enough to feed his family.

That’s why Roin decided to diversify the business and purchase cell phones and accessories for selling from his workshop. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience.  

After several unsuccessful attempts, Roin applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of US$3,000 will help Roin to purchase cell phones in bulk and sell them for a profit. Roin is very enthusiastic and a hard-working person with a great desire to ensure his child with a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. 

Roin is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and accessories in bulk for resale

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 34-year-old woman. She has two children aged 3 years and 14 years. She describes herself as talkative. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a commercial area and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy threads, cloth sheets and other sewing materials. Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to graduate level. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy threads, cloth sheets and other sewing materials

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a 39-year-old married woman. She has two children aged 6 years and 12 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a school where she offers education to pupils.
