What she likes about this business is that she meets new people each day. It makes her proud to have money in her home every day. 

She wants to open a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more onion, vita, salt, pepper, etc in order to re-sell them.

loans.name: Anniemaude

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Anniemaude. She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 3 years. In 2003, Anniemaude established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in taking care of their home. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leone) every month form this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Anniemaude requires a loan in order to buy more drugs for her pharmacy. In the future, Anniemaude plans to open another shop, provide support for the education of her children to university level and to become an international businesswoman. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 51 years old, married, and has two children. 

Prescila is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Prescila has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Prescila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is from Shirakavan village, of the Shirak region. He lives with his wife and three school-age children. 

Through years of hard work, Aram owns a farm which helps him to sustain his family's living. Now, for increasing cultivation of wheat, he needs financial support to purchase wheat seeds. So, he has applied for this loan to purchase wheat seeds and forage for feeding his livestock. The loan will greatly help him to gather more agricultural income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and forage.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 60 años de edad, solo estudio segundo grado, ya que sus padres eran pobres y no veían importante el estudio. Es madre soltera de dos hijas de 19 y 15 años, su compañero de vida la dejo hace 12 años, desde entonces le a tocado sostener a su familia; una de sus hijas trabaja en un comedor y la otra esta estudiando noveno grado. 
Ella trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenia unos 12 años, ya que siempre le ayudo a su papá en la siembra de maíz, hoy trabaja en una hacienda siempre en la misma actividad. Nos cuenta que le agradece a su padre el verle enseñado a trabajar, hoy que se quedo sola, le sirvió para sacar a delante a sus hijas.
El préstamo, será utilizado en la compra de 500 bloques, 10 bolsas de cemento, 2 quintales de hierro, arena y para mano de obra, esto cambiara su vida;  ya que hoy solo tiene la galera y con el crédito, podrá cerrarla y darle una mejor seguridad a sus hijas. 
Su sueño, es poder dejarle una vivienda digna a sus hijas, que se gradué la que esta estudiando, poder comprar lo que necesita para cerrar su  vivienda
texts.en:
María is a woman 60 years of age.  She only studied until the second grade, since her parents were poor and didn't view education as important.  She is a single mother to two daughters, 19 and 15 years old.  Her life partner left her 12 years ago, and since then she has had to support her family.  One of her daughters works in a cafeteria, and the other is in the ninth grade.

She has worked in agriculture since she was around 12 years old, since she always helped her father planting corn.  Now she works on a farm doing the same thing.  She tells us that it pleases her father to have taught her to work.  Now that she is alone, it has helped her get her daughters ahead.

The loan will be used in the purchase of 500 cinder blocks, 10 bags of cement, 2 quintals of iron, and sand, and to pay for labor.  This will change her life.  Since she only has a covered patio now, with the loan, she will be able to close it off and offer greater security to her daughters.  Her dream is to be able to leave a worthy house to her daughters, to have the one who is studying graduate, and to be able to buy what she needs to close up her house.

loans.use: to buy 500 cinder blocks, 10 bags of cement, 2 quintals of iron, and sand, and to pay for labor costs, to finish building her house.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a married man with four children. He describes himself as an entrepreneur and a risk taker. 

Leonard operates a fish stall, selling fish. He will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. Seven members of the family will benefit from this water tank. The family faces a challenge of water shortage. 

He hopes that in the future, he will improve profits. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Life

texts.en:
“My husband has been disabled for a very long time, yet, this hasn't stopped him from helping me out in whatever I do. The agriculture that we do requires hard labor, but my husband finds his ways to help me,” Life said.

Life has four grownup children and they all live in a village nearby, a main city. Agriculture/livestock is what they have been practicing for the past twenty years. “We have been selling raw milk and fresh veggies and fruits, mostly to the local market of the city. Through this, we have been able to generate an income. For most villagers, agriculture becomes the only source of income, but the amount of work, including the hard labor and the extended hours we pour into it, will never be paid off,” Life said.

Life wants to add another dairy cow and buy some fodder for her animals.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and some fodder for the animals.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming flowers in the Philippines. Rosa is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosa has been farming flowers for 10 years and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load, food vending, raising pigs and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Doña Maria vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace varios años, es una persona humilde, servicial, y honesta muy dedicada a sus labores, cuando sus cosechas ya están listas las almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía  para luego salir a comercializarlas en los alrededores de la zona y también la adquieren gente de otras partes, tiene una gran demanda de sus productos, ya que son de muy buena calidad y además es muy amble a la hora de atender a sus clientes, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para cultivo de frijol, maíz etc. Para poder incrementar sus cultivos, obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Maria lives with her husband and children in the family's home. She has for several years worked growing staple gains, and is a humble, conscientious, honest woman who is devoted to her work. 

When her crops are ready for harvest, Doña Maria stores them in the granaries shown in the photo. She then sells her crops around the region and also to people in other parts of the country. Demand for Doña Maria's crops are high, as she offers high quality and excellent customer service. Doña Maria has thus been able to meet many of her expenses. She's applying for a loan to purchase supplies to grow corn, beans, and other crops. These supplies will allow Doña Maria to boost her yields and her income, and provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKOLA  est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 8éme prêt. Les 7 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  beigne
à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la 1éré femme debout de la gauche vers la droite Elle fait la vente de  beignet et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 Kilo de beurre de karité et 100Kg de mil à Tono.  Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Benkola group is made up 7 women, all of whom are married and who are on average 38 years old and have six children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the village of Méridièla. They know one another through neighborhood, friendship and commercial ties. In order to strengthen their financial capacity, so that they can better run their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are on their eighth loan. The 7 previous loans were properly paid back. Together, this group of women runs a doughnut business. In the image, Fatoumata is the first woman standing, from the left to the right. She sells the doughnuts and expects to buy with her loan 25 kilos of shea butter and 100kg of millet in Tono. She will make her sales at the market and in her home, at retail prices, in cash and in credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 12,000 FCFA which will be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make doughnuts.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 28-year-old lady from the Vihiga County found in the Western part of Kenya. She supports six people in her family. Her husband is also a businessman and together they are blessed with three children who are 11, 10 and 3 years old respectively.

Carolyne sells fish, a business she has been doing for the last 9 years and gets a monthly income of Kes 35,000. She is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to increase her working capital as well as buy different types of fish for reselling at a profit. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back to her business as well as invest in the education of her children.

Carolyne's desire and dream is to become the main supplier of fish within the region as well as educating her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy different types of fish for reselling at a profit

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a 26-year-old single man, describes himself as committed. He has been operating a transport business for three years now, conveying his customers from various backgrounds by bicycle. His biggest business challenge is insufficient capital. 

Charles will use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle. His business goal is to purchase a motor vehicle within five years, as he hopes to open a transport company. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother of five children: three are in school and the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Margaret practices poultry keeping, and she sells to her neighbors and butchery shops. She cited poultry diseases as a challenge in the business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more chicks and poultry feed for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman and has 3 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of sugar, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to open a big supermarket within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a business that can support her family comfortably. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used bottles, scraps of used materials, and plastic.

loans.name: Markardor

texts.en:
Markardor lives in Sanniqiuillie, the capital city of Nimba County. She is 27 years old, unmarried, and has two children ages 4 and 8 who are in school and live at home. She is a high school graduate and her boyfriend is a driver. 

Since 2009 she has been running a table business where she sells palm oil. She says one of the problems she has faced is that most of her costumers complain about the price of palm oil being too high.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. In the future she wants to send her children to college and expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina runs a small stall which sells groceries, snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and bill payment services. Lina lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Lina is married and has three children.

Lina began working with Ruma three months ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $10 - $15 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

Recently, she took a loan from Kiva for getting a printer to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to buy a printer to print out required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Clotilda

texts.es:
Clotilda es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de familiares que se encuentra en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio  hasta el nivel secundario. Desempeña las funciones como ayundante de carpinteria (lunes a sabado), su sueldo es con  cancelacion de jornal .
Necesita crédito para la compra de herramientas, es el primer paso para la independencia.
El sueño de Clotilda es tener su propia carpinteria y tener mejores ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Clotilda is single, has no children and lives in a family house situated in the city of El Alto. She studied up to secondary school level.  She carries out duties as a carpentry assistant (Monday to Saturday) and her salary is paid on a daily basis. She needs a loan in order to purchase tools - it is her first step towards independence. Her dream is to have her own carpentry business and to have a better income. This is the first time that she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and her first time too with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy carpentry tools

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход молодой бизнесмен, проживающий в городе Куляб. Ему 26 лет. Он женат, имеет двухлетнего сына. Вместе с семьей Фархода живет его старый 80-летний отец. Жена Фархода ухаживает за свёкорю и за своим малышом. Одновременно она ведет домашние дела и занимается шитьем. Фарход является главным кормильцем семьи. У него имеется собственный торговый бизнес. Он в течение 7 лет занимается продажей женской одежды и женских платков. Его торговая точка находится на центральном рынке города. Фарход в месяц дважды едет в столицу, закупает товар оптом, привозит в свой город и продает по розничной цене. Чтобы развить бизнес он обратился за кредитом. Фарход на сумму кредита хочет приобрести ассортимент сезонной женской одежды. Он в будущем планирует купить автомашину для перевозки своего товара.
texts.en: Farhod is a young businessman, living in the city of Kulob.  He is 26 years old, married and has a two-year-old son.  Farhod's 80 year-old father lives with the family as well.  Farhod's wife takes care of the mother-in-law and her toddler.  She runs the household and does sewing concurrently.  Farhod is the primary provider for the family.  He has his own retail business.  He has been involved in selling women's clothing and women's scarves.  His retail outlet is located at the city's central market.  Farhod travels to the capital twice per month, buys merchandise wholesale, brings it to his city and sells it at retail prices.  He requested a loan to develop his business.  Farhod wants to buy a selection of seasonal women's clothing.  He plans to buy a car for transporting his merchandise in the future.

loans.use: to buy a selection of seasonal women's clothing in order to develop his business

loans.name: Bitessi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BITESSI est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans village de Méridièla. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de viande à l’image de KOROTOUMOU qui est la 1ére femme assise de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 7 Kg de viande tous les jeudi et lundi  avec les bouchers. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de10.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Bitessi group is made up 7 women, all of whom are married, and on average are 40 years old and have six children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the village of Méridièla. They know one another through neighborhood, friendship and commercial ties. In order to strengthen their financial capacity, so that they can better run their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are on their first loan. This group of women sells meat. In the image, Korotoumou is the first woman seated, from the left to the right. She expects to buy with her loan 7 kilos of meat from the butchers each Thursday and Monday. She will make her sales at the market and from her home, at retail prices, in cash and in credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA which will be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is a 38-year-old married woman with three school-aged children.  She and her spouse own and work on a small farm to grow rice to make a living.  The land doesn't produce enough to feed their children, so her husband also dedicates time to a recycling business that collects and sells materials for additional income.  Both businesses earn them a moderate income to provide basic necessities and send their children to school.

Keo’s husband is in need of capital to invest in his recycling business and buy a trailer for loading the collected materials.  For this reason, she has requested a loan in the sum of KHR 4,000,000 from Kiva lenders.  She has had prior loans with HKL and has never made any late payments to her loans.  This loan will create another opportunity for her husband to advance his business as well as their family's standard of living.

loans.use: to help her husband invest in his recycling business and buy a trailer for loading the collected materials.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es separada, tiene tres hijos, tiene casa propia en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel primaria. Ella sobrevive vendiendo comida a los empleados de una fábrica de plásticos
Necesita crédito para incremento de capital, así podrá comprar mayores cantidades de arroz, fideo, aceite y otros. Cumpliendo así con mayores demandas de su producto.
El sueño de Gladys es tener un restaurant con todas sus comodidades. Es la primera vez que acude a KIVA.
texts.en: Gladys is separated, has three children and has her own house in the city of El Alto. She only studied up to primary level at school. She survives selling food to employees of a plastics factory. She needs a loan in order to increase her available capital. She will then be able to buy greater quantities of rice, noodles, oil, etc., thereby meeting the increasing demand for her her product. Her dream is to have a fully equipped restaurant. This is the first time that she has turned to Kiva.

loans.use: to increase the capital she has available for her catering business

loans.name: Ma. Nelia

texts.en:
Ma. Nelia works hard to support her family. Ma. Nelia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Nelia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of shampoo, bath soap, coffee, soy sauce and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Nelia has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Ma. Nelia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of shampoo, bath soap, coffee, soy sauce and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Amro

texts.en:
Amro lives in a remote area of ​​the Kulyab, in the Muminobod area, where many people are in poverty. Born in 1963 in the village of Tuto, he is a respectable man who resides with his wife, two sons and one daughter. 


Amro has faced many difficulties in his life but now works 10 days per month as a fireman in a small brick factory in Kulyab. He has decided to drive a taxi  in his spare time, and so is requesting a loan of 2000 USD which, along with his savings, will enable him to purchase a car. With a mini-business plan and a route established, he will work from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. 


Amro looks forward to your support because it will give him the strength to go forward and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase an Opel car to start a new activity

loans.name: Daguele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DAGUELE est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  chaussures à l’image de AWA qui est la 1ére femme dèbout dans la photos de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 22 paires de chaussures avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Daguele Group is composed of 4 women, all of whom are married, and who average 24 years of age and one child each. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the village of Méridièla. They know one another through ties of community, friendship and business. In order to strengthen their financial capacity, so that they can better run their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are on their first loan. This group of women runs a shoe business. In the image, Awa is the first woman standing in the photo, from left to right. She expects to buy 22 pairs of shoes from the wholesalers in Bamako with her loan. She will make her sales at the market and from her home, at retail prices, in cash and in credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 f CFA which will be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es separada, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa de sus suegros en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel de primaria. Sobrevive cocinando comida boliviana (sajta de pollo, aji de fideo, revuelto) de lunes a sabado en su quiosco 
Necesita credito para incremento de capital que le permita comprar arroz, fideo, aceite y otros.
El sueño de Lucia es tener un restaurant con todas sus comodidades y asi tener mejores ingresos y  calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito a KIVA.
texts.en: Lucia is separated, has two children and lives with her in-laws in the city of El Alto. She only studied up to primary school level. She survives by cooking Bolivian food (Sajta chicken, chili noodles, revuelto) from her kiosk from Monday to Saturday. She needs a loan to increase her available capital, enabling her to buy rice, noodles, oil etc. Her dream is to have a fully equipped restaurant and so have a better income and quality of life. This is the first time that she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to increase her capital

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es separada, tiene cuatro hijos, tiene casa propia en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel primario. Sobrevive dedicandose a vender comida en diferentes ferias 
El crédito lo requiere para la instalacion de servicios basicos en su domicilio ya que no cuenta con las mismos
El sueño de Teodora es ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito a KIVA.
texts.en: Teodora is separated, has four children, and has her own house in the city of El Alto. She only studied up to primary school level. She survives by selling food at different fairs. She requires a loan in order to install basic utilities at home because she doesn't have them now. Her dream is to provide greater comfort to her children. This is the first time that she has applied to Kiva for a loan.

loans.use: to install basic utilities

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es casado, tiene casa propia en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario. Para vivir atiende un depósito en el cual se guarda quinua,naranja, papaya. Trabaja de lunes a sabado, anteriormente se dedicaba a la costura pero por motivos de  salud tuvo que dejar esta actividad 
 El crédito lo requiere para la refaccion de su deposito, necesita cemento, estuco, arena y otros
texts.en: Santiago is married and has his own house in the city of El Alto. He studied up to secondary school level. He works from Monday to Saturday looking after a warehouse which stores quinoa, orange and papaya. Previously he made his living sewing, but he had to leave this position due to health reasons. He requires a loan in order to make repairs to his warehouse. He needs cement, stucco, sand etc.

loans.use: to carry out repair work and to buy building materials

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: As a parent of one child, Norma works hard to support her family.  She has a tricicad business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending, fattening pigs, fishing, and motorcycle transport.  Norma is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricicad maintenance.  Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricicad maintenance

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man.  He has 2 children.  He describes himself as very aggressive.  He operates a grinding mill where he grinds maize.  He has been involved in this business for 1 year.  His business is located in an area with good potential.  He describes his biggest business challenge as not meeting the demand of customers.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ten bags of maize.  His business goal is to have the biggest grinding mill within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of maize

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is happily married to her husband, and blessed with four children. Her children are still studying. Ma. Liza and her husband manage their farming business, which is the growing of rice in their field.

Because there are so many requirements in school, sometimes she asks for her relative’s financial support just to meet the needs of the children. Ma. Liza admits that she it's hard to sustain their agricultural needs. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides. 

She hopes to get a better yield and a better income as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 53 years old and married with six children.

Agnes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, groceries, etc. to sell.

Agnes has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine and from pig fattening.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Agnes aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DEMBAGNOUMA est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de   MERIDIELA. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 10éme prêt. Les 9 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers à l’image de SADIO qui est la 1ére femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5Kg de viande, du beurre de karité et des condiments tous les jours au marché. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Dembagnouma Group is composed of 4 women, all of whom are married, and who average 33 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the village of Méridièla. They know one another through ties of community, friendship and business. In order to strengthen their financial capacity, so that they can better run their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are on their tenth loan. The nine previous loans were properly paid back. This group of women runs a business selling various items. In the image, Sadio is the first woman standing in the photo, from left to right. She expects to buy 5 kilos of meat, shea butter and vegetables and spices to make sauces every day in the market with her loan. She will make her sales at the market and from her home, at retail prices, for cash and for credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 f CFA which will be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase various items.

loans.name: Luis  Alfredo

texts.es: Luis  de 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia  junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres  hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y  frijol,  es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, dedicado a sus labores, posee gran demanda de sus productos por su buena calidad, Luis solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. Para poder continuar con sus cultivos y abastecer su demanda, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is thirty-six years old, and he lives in his own home together with his life partner and their three children.  He makes a living growing corn and beans.  He is a very humble and hardworking person, and he is dedicated to his work.  There is a great demand for his products, since they are good-quality items.  

Luis is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies, like seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc.  He hopes to be able to continue with his crops and meet the demand, obtain better income, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, like seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta vive en casa de un familiar junto a su mama y sus hermanos, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace mas de 2 años, en el mercado municipal que se encuentra cerca de su casa, es una persona responsable, con una excelente moral  y muy buenas referencias,  además muy atenta y amable con sus clientes, sus productos son muy demandados en la zona donde los comercializa, ya que posee una clientela establecida, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado satisfacer algunos de sus gastos. la clienta solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de papas, zanahorias, tomates, etc. para poder obtener mayores ingresos, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This client lives her family's house with her mother and siblings.  She has made a living selling vegetables for more than two years in the town market located close to her home.  She is a responsible person with excellent morals and very good references.  She is also very attentive and kind to her customers.  Her products are in high demand in the area where she sells, and she already has an established customer base.  Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to cover some expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  She will buy potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, etc. so that she can get more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family,

loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Dissibaw Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DISSIBAW est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de  MERIDIELA. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 10éme prêt. Les 9 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments à l’image de KONIMBA.qui est la 1ére debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 4 sacs de 25Kg de sel de cuisine, 3 cartons de cube Maggi  auprès des grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Dissibaw Group is composed of 7 women, all of whom are married, and who average 35 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the village of Méridièla. They know one another through ties of community, friendship and business. In order to strengthen their financial capacity, so that they can better run their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are on their tenth loan. The 9 previous loans were properly paid back. This group of women runs a business selling vegetables and spices for making sauces. In the image, Konimba is the first standing in the photo, from right to left. With her loan, she expects to buy four 25-kilo bags of cooking salt and 3 boxes of bouillon cubes from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She will make her sales at the market and from her home, at retail prices, for cash and for credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 f CFA which will be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices for making sauces.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 5 years. She describes herself as determined.  She operates an M-pesa service where she offers mobile phone based money transfer. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge as money laundering by some clients. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add float (electronic credits to sell). This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add float to her M-pesa service

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 4 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues  Dakaroises. Au départ elles se fréquentaient   a travers des  tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus .Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes  pour les aider  a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 4  est un groupe de crédit de 11 femmes  qui habitent le même quartier et exerce évolue dans le même secteur d’activité. Elles sont représentées par madame Seynabou, femme mariée qui pratique depuis 2005 l’activité commerciale de vente de tissus et chaussures. Elle démarre chaque jour sa journée e de travail a 10heures du matin pour descendre a 17 heures. Les bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer a la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de chaussures et de tissus destinés  a la vente. Elle souhaite augmenter les bénéfices qu’elle réalise a travers ce prêt. Elle veut épargner de l’argent et aussi améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet futur consiste a développer davantage son activité de commerce.
texts.en: The And Siggil Hann Association brings together several women from one of the neighborhoods of Dakar. At the beginning, they were involved in weekly savings groups that allowed them to provide their own finance to support their revenue-generating businesses. At present, the association has just signed a partnership with UIMCEC in the framework of reinforcing the women's economic strength, in order to help them better manage their businesses and fight against poverty. Consequently, And Siggil Hann 4 is a loan group of 11 women who live in the same area and are skilled in the same business sector. They are represented by Ms. Seynabou, a married woman, who has run a commercial business since 2005 selling cloth and shoes. She begins her day each day at 10 a.m. and gets off at 5 p.m. The profits that her business brings in allow her to help with the daily expenses of her household. She is the member of one of UIMCEC's offices, where she is asking for a loan intended for the purchase of shoes and cloths, which are destined for sale. She wishes to increase the profits that she makes through this loan. She wants to save some money and also improve her family's eating conditions. Her future project will consist of developing her commercial business even more.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Aminata. She is married and has one child aged three.

In 2002, Aminata established her cooking and kitchen utensils sales business. The business was started to help her husband run the affairs of their home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns approximately 1,800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Aminata has already received and successfully repaid six prior loans, and she now wants a new loan to pay for additional products such as food containers, tea cups, enamel spoons, and drinking cups. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her inventory and raise her profits. In the future, Aminata plans to expand the business to the outskirts of town and to transform the business (to sell baby clothing) with the hope of making additional profits. She started her business in a stall and now has a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional kitchen utensils for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Michille

texts.en:
Michille works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Michille requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Michille would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Basiliza

texts.en:
Basiliza is 65 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Basiliza has been pig fattening for ten years and also earns additional income from vending vegetables and farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nelia is 52 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Nelia has a rag making business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.  Nelia has been in this business for 25 years. 

Nelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Norma Carolina

texts.es: Norma,tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijas. Solicita crédito para estudiar un doctorado en Educación con especialidad en Mediación pedagógica. Actualmente labora en el departamento de postgrados y maestrías de una universidad del país. Con este doctorado Norma pretende especializarse en herramientas que contribuyan a mejorar el sistema educativo de Nicaragua, puesto que actualmente carecemos de especialistas en esta materia.Su objetivo es apoyar la educación en poblaciones de escasos recursos.
texts.en: Norma is 34 years old and married, with 2 daughters. She is requesting a loan to study for a doctorate in Education, with a specialty in Pedagogical Mediation. She currently works in the master's and postgraduate department of a university in the country. With this doctorate, Norma intends to specialize in tools which can contribute to improving the educational system in Nicaragua, since there is currently a lack of specialists in this area. Her goal is to support education in low-income communities.

loans.use: to pay for her doctoral program.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mishi operates a retail shop business, and she has been in this business for the last two years. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and tea leaves for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Angus

texts.en:
Angus appreciates the previous loan he got from Kiva, which enabled him to earn profit and improve his living standards. In addition to his public addressing system business, he has a poultry farming business.

Angus is requesting 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase poultry feed and to buy five chicks. He thanks Yehu and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and to buy five chicks.

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Beatriz vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de sombreros, desde hace mas de 10 años, es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante y mejorar sus condición de vida además es muy atenta y amble con sus clientes lo que la ha llevado a ganarse la confianza de ellos por lo cual prefieren sus productos, de esta manera ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares. Doña Beatriz solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería  por mayor para poder surtir su negocio y así abastecer la demanda que posee, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives in her own home with her two daughters.  She has made a living selling hats for more than ten years.  She is a very hardworking person with the determination to move herself ahead and to improve her living condition.  She is very attentive and kind to her customers, and this has allowed her to win their trust so that they now prefer her products.  In this way, she has been able to cover some of the family's expenses.

Beatriz is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise wholesale.  She will be able to stock her business and thereby cover the demand for her products, earn better income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hats wholesale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Gina has been in this business for five years; she earns more income from a buy and sell rice grains business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to pay laborers salaries and to buy new rice seed for her rice farming business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers salaries and buy new rice seed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old from Nakuru. She is a widow and supports a family of four children, aged 15, 13, 6 and 3 years old, all of whom are her grandchildren.

She is in the hotel industry, a business she has been running for the past 13 years. After repaying her previous loan successfully, she has applied for her second loan of KES 40,000 from Kadet Ltd, which she intends to use to restock her hotel with additional food items as a means of boosting her business.

Her hope and dream for the future is to build rental houses to add to her source of income.

loans.use: to restock her hotel with additional food items

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as determined. 

He will use the KES 16,500 loan to buy a water tank that will benefit five family members. They will be able to store enough water for domestic use. The family faces the challenge of insufficient clean water. 

He transports customers using a motorcycle to earn an income. He hopes that in the future, he will have a healthy family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a married man. He has two children, ages 5 and 10 years. He describes himself to be strong and determined. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climatic conditions. 

He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy another bicycle. He hopes that in the future, he will achieve his goals in life. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest.

Annah operates a poultry business where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in her residential home and her primary customers are hotels and retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fact that at times the weather conditions are not favorable.

She will use the loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more chicks and feed. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family's demands. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a dairy farm where she produces milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Her business is located near a busy market and her primary customers are loyal customers from the surrounding area and commercial customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to purchase cow feeds and other items. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cow feeds and other items. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cow feeds and other items.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 22 years old, and works hard to provide his family’s income all by himself.

Hussain owns a small workplace where he specializes in repairing motorcycles, and also in selling spare parts for different types of motorcycles. Hussain has been in this field since 2010 and since then, he has been gaining much experience in this field and has gained much fame in the surrounding area.

Hussain is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. The aim of this loan is to install a sunshade, install new shelves, and to buy a piece of specialized equipment for his work. Hussain is aiming to improve his work quality in order to attract more customers and thus, increase his profits. 

With the increase in his profits, Hussain will be able to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to install a sunshade, install new shelves, and to buy a piece of specialized equipment for his work

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is 47 years old and from the village of Persati. She is married, and lives with her spouse and 15-year-old son in their own house.

Izolda has a part-time job at the local lemonade company, and works as a waitress at the café as well. She gets a small monthly income, and runs an agricultural business, too. She grows nuts on the family owned plot of land and sells the harvest seasonally. Unfortunately, the existing income is not enough to make ends meet for them. So, Izolda decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. 

Izolda’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn't satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This Start-up Program gives vulnerable poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of 500 GEL, she will purchase secondhand clothing at wholesale prices and sell them in her community. Izolda will offer her customers a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women, and children. She is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased due to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Zein Al Abidin

texts.en:
Zein Al Abidin is a single Iraqi youth client who is 19 years old and lives with his family, composed of four members; one is employed.

Zein Al Abidin owns a small shop where he tailors men's outfits. In 2008, at his young age, he enrolled in this field and started helping his father with his work. After gaining all the needed experience in this field, he took over his father’s business and started to help his father in providing the family’s income. Zein Al Abidin has gained good experience in this field and is loved by many.

He is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install a new rolling shutter for his shop, and to buy some raw materials to increase his production. 

Zein Al Abidin is aiming to grow more in this field, and is hoping that this loan will give him the chance to increase his production and provide him a better standard of living.

loans.use: to install a new rolling shutter for his shop, and to buy some raw materials to increase his production

loans.name: Víctor Velisario

texts.es:
El Sr. Víctor tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, reside en una comunidad del municipio  de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes, junto a uno de sus hijos.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajo asalariado en la empresa privada, la empresa cerró operaciones y al quedar sin empleo decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta y reparación de teléfonos celulares.
Actualmente ha solicitado un tercer préstamo a la Institución y por la cantidad de 20,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar teléfonos celulares, accesorios (cobertores,  cargadores, recargas de saldo, para vender) y repuestos para la reparación de los mismos como ser baterías pantallas y otros.
Su meta es desarrollar más el negocio y ver un crecimiento considerable.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor is 63 years old, married, and has two children.  He resides in a community in the town of San Pedro Sula, Department of Cortes, with one of his children.

Victor was previously a salaried employee at a private company.  When his employer ceased operations and he lost his job, Victor decided to establish his own business of selling and repairing mobile phones.  He is currently requesting his third loan from ODEF in the amount of 20,000 HNL.  Victor will use the money to buy mobile phones, accessories (covers, chargers, and refillable phone cards to sell), and spare parts for making repairs such as batteries, screens, and other items.  

His goal is to development his business even more so that he can see significant growth.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, accessories, and spare parts.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, tiene 38 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 7 años. Tiene como otra fuente de ingresos la ayuda económica que le brinda su esposo. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Blusas, pantalones, faldas, camisas, calcetines entre otros con el fin de surtir su negocio. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar y su  calidad de vida. Estima que este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que surtirá  su negocio, aumentara sus ventas y obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Isabel is from the city of Boaco. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She is a merchant by trade and has sold new clothing for 7 years. She has it as another source of income to help her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy: blouses, pants, skirts, shirts, socks and more. Her plan for the future is to improve her home's infrastructure and her quality of life. She thinks that this loan will be a big help since it will stock her business, increase her sales and bring in more income.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, skirts, shorts, socks and more.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine lives in Sinkor, one of the areas where the living conditions are almost like the people who live in the center of Monrovia. She is 30 years old and married with three children between the ages of four and nine who are in school and live at home. She was unfortunate to stop her education at 5th grade. For seven years now she has been involved in sales of cassava, meat, and chicken. Sometimes her customers get credit and don’t pay. She learned this trade from her schoolmate. She likes her business because it makes her self-sufficient. She is requesting a loan to purchase cassava, meat, and chicken for her business. Her plans are to build a house and take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, meat, and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 48-year-old businessman in Mwingi who is married to Purity. They are blessed with two children, aged 15 and 10. He runs a business selling assorted goods. He also operates a boutique shop to supplement his income. He currently lacks sufficient funds to purchase enough goods to serve his ever-growing customer base. 

With a loan through KADET LTD, Isaac will be able to purchase more wristwatches, radios, cups, jugs and thermal flasks. He is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD, having successfully cleared his previous loan. Additional income created will allow him to invest in his clothes-selling business. 

In the future, Isaac would like to have his children lead a good life by investing in their education.

loans.use: to purchase more wristwatches, radios, cups, jugs and thermal flasks

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband Paata and their two children.

Nino works at a local wine factory and gets a small monthly salary. Her son is unemployed and her daughter is a nurse at the local hospital. As the existing income is not enough for the family, Nino decided to start a family business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts was unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions.

The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Nino's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $3,000 US dollars. With the received credit, she will purchase a truck for Paata will bring wood from the forest to resell at a good price.

She hopes that the business will be profitable, as wood is a very popular way of heating houses in winter times. The new business initiative will give the family a chance to generate more income and thus improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to transport wood from the forest to resell.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a 50-year-old woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 14 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be determined to succeed. 

Rael operates a dairy farm where she produces milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located near a busy market and her primary customers are loyal customers from the surrounding area and commercial customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to purchase cow feeds and other items.

She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase cow feed and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will build a large supermarket. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase cow feed and other items.

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en:
Gurban is a positive and good-humored man. He is hard-working, lives in a rural region, and works fattening cattle in his village. He is married and has three children attending school. 

Gurban is conscientious, honest, and dedicated. He works a lot to provide consistent income for his family. For that reason, he runs his own business. Also, he and his wife receive a pension because of head injuries received during the war.
 
After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Gurban realized the need to improve his home. With this housing loan, he can pay for the improvements and save to do more. 

He will use this loan to buy cement and other building materials to start the repair work. 

He thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cement and other items to repair his house.

loans.name: Mouhsen

texts.en:
Mouhsen is 28 years old and married with two children. He is a youth client from Iraq and is the only provider for his family.
In 2010, Mouhsen established a small shop where he sells fruits and vegetables. He now has an employee and has gained good experience in this field.
Mouhsen is well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Mouhsen is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan to install a display window for his shop and to increase his inventory. In the future, his goal is to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to install a display window for his shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Ambrocia

texts.es:
Ambrocia es una joven de 21 años de edad la cual es madre de un hijo en un estado civil en unión libre que acompaña de su pareja se dedican a la agricultura siendo su especialidad la siembra, cultivo y venta de café pero también cautivan en temporadas frías maíz y frijoles. Ella tiene 6 años de educación primaria la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo financiero de sus padres siendo ellos los mismos quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra desde muy temprana edad. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 40 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie para dar asistencia y mantenimiento. Uno de sus grandes desafíos es el aumento de su producción y mejorar la calidad del terreno para poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café como el caturra que es mejor pagado en el mercado.

Sus planes a futuro es poder construir una casa humilde con las necesidades básicas para poder vivir ofreciendo a su hijo un techo para el día de mañana y ahí mismo tener siempre sus cultivos para poder darle un mantenimiento y asistencia personalizada.   

Es por esa razón que actualmente ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para la preparación de un pedazo de tierra para cultivar, 6 QQ de urea, 6 QQ de 18-46-0, otra parte para del efectivo para la fumigación, 10 kilos de nutrí café y 12 kilos de evicec para dar una mejor asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y aprovechar al máximo la cosecha próxima.
texts.en:
Ambrocia is a young 21 year old woman.  She is in a common law marriage and has one son; she and her husband work as farmers.  They raise and sell coffee, and in the colder seasons, corn and beans.  She has a sixth grade education, thanks to her parents’ support.  It was they who taught her how to work the land at a young age.  Her crops are located 40 minutes from her home and she walks there to maintain her crops.  One of her greatest challenges is increasing her production and improving the quality of her crops so she can have a better quality coffee, such as caturra which brings a better price.

Her plans for the future are to build a humble home with basic requirements so she can offer her son a roof over his head for tomorrow.  She also wants to always have her crops all the time so she can care for them personally.

It’s for this reason that she is asking for a loan to prepare a section of land for farming, 6 QQ of urea, 6 QQ of 18-46-0, and also to fumigate, 10 kg of nutri café and 12 kg of evicec to maintain her coffee crops and take maximum advantage of the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Juana Estela

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una mujer de 51 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora con muchas fuerzas y deseos de superarse, casada y madre de 3 hijos. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa con un grado de educación primario cursado hasta el 3 grado y agradece a sus padres el esfuerzo impuesto para que ella pudiese tener un pequeño conocimiento ya que en ese entonces la situación financiera y los medios eran muy difíciles. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron la actividad de la agricultura desde muy joven en la siembra y cultivo de granos básicos como ser arroz, maíz y frijol desde muy temprana edad junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Sus cultivos están ubicados en la misma propiedad donde ella habita lo cual le permite estar al tanto y muy pendiente de los mismos de prevenir plagas, animales entre otros que puedan dañarlo. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en la zona donde ella habita y en los alrededores con los vecinos y zonas aledañas bodegas, pulperías, etc.  

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla certificada para poder cultivar un poco más en su propiedad ya que quiere aprovechar al máximo un espacio libre y darle uso al mismo.

Sus planes a futuro son los de mejorar su casa de habitación ya que necesita unos arreglos como repello, algunos detalle en el techo, etc. para el bienestar de su familia. Sus prioridades son los de poder aumentar más sus parcelas de tierra, formar un buen patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos en el cual puedan trabajar y enfrentar los diferentes problemas financieros que hoy en día se atraviesan.
texts.en:
Juana is a 51 year old hardworking and enterprising woman with a great desire to succeed.  She is married, the mother of three children, and works as a farmer.  She has a third grade education and is grateful for her parents’ effort that allowed her to learn at least a little bit, given that the financial situation was very difficult then.  It was they who taught her to farm when she was very young and she raised basic grains such as rice, corn, and beans from a very young age, along with her husband and children.  Her crops are located on the same land where they live and this allows them to be very vigilant of them and prevent blights, insects, and other things that can damage them.  Her products are sold in her area and the surrounding areas’ shops, stores, etc.

She is asking for help with the purchase of seeds so she can raise a bit more on her land so she can take maximum advantage and use the free space.

She plans to take make some improvements to her home, which needs some plaster, some work to the roof, etc. for her family’s wellbeing.  Her priorities are to be able to increase her amount of land, have a good relationship with her children and grandchildren, and confront the financial problems that get in her way.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Melitina

texts.es:
Doña Melitina tiene una edad de 41 años es agricultora y ama de casa madre de 6 hijos los cuales viven con ella y su esposo. Tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleto el cual pudo cursar hasta el 3 grado ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y la distribución de sus ingresos era limitada la cual alcanzaba en ocasiones para lo básico (alimentación, vestimenta, etc.). Ella en compañía de su esposo el cual trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una empresa se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café ya hace varios años siendo este uno de sus ingresos económicos a parte del salario de su esposo para el sustento de su familia. El grano al final de la cosecha es vendido a los diferentes intermediarios y bodegas de la zona.

Ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara 6 QQ de nutrí café, 10 litros de foliar, 8 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 y 6 QQ de urea para proteger y abonar sus cultivos ya que al final de la cosecha espera obtener buenos ingresos.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder cultivar más café ya que la tierra que ellos tienen es propia y apta por su clima localidad y mantenimiento para el mismo. Su sueño es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que tenga muchas opciones y oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Melitina is 41 years old. She is a farmer and the at-home mother of 6 children, who live with her and her husband. She has an incomplete primary education, since she was only able to attend up to 3rd grade, since her parents had few resources and their income was only sufficient to cover the basics (food, clothing, etc.). She is accompanied by her husband who works as a security guard for a company. They have worked planting and cultivating coffee for several years. This is one of their sources of income to sustain the family, in addition to her husband's salary. After the harvest, the coffee beans are sold to various intermediaries and warehouses in the area. 

She is requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative, with which she will buy 6 quintals of NutriCafé, 10 liters of foliar formula, 8 quintals of 18-46-0 fertilizer and 6 quintals of urea, to protect and fertilize her crops. She hopes to obtain a good income at the end of the harvest. 

Her plans for the future are to be able to cultivate more coffee, since they own their land and it is favorable for growing coffee in this climate and this area. Her dream is to be able to give her children a good education, so that they will have many options and opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Catalina Sobeyda

texts.es: La señora Catalina trabaja en el mercado desde hace 15 años ofrece productos de artesania, tipicos, colchones, batellas, perchas, comales, canastos etc, vende de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cuatro y media de la tarde, es soltera, no tiene hijos, trabaja para el sustento de su mamá quien depende de ella. la señora solicita financiamiento para compra de productos patrios como banderas, artesania dedicadas a chinandega ya que viene el mes de septiembre y es donde aprovecha la ventas de estos productos.
texts.en: Catalina has worked in the market for 15 years, selling typical handicrafts, mattresses, trays, coat hangers, tortilla pans, baskets etc. She works from Monday to Sunday from 7am to 4.30pm.  She is single and childless and works to support her mother, who is dependent on her.  The lady is seeking funding to buy patriotic items such as Chinandega flags and local handicrafts as September is approaching and because it is here that she benefits from the sale of these products.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts, products typical of Chinandega, baskets, trays, tortilla pans, mattresses and hats

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Carmen se dedica a la cría y venta cerdos  desde hace varios años es un persona con muy buenas referencias de los vecinos ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta  como también emprendedora  y posee una clientela muy fiel a sus productos, vive en casa de un familiar con su hija de 18 años quien estudia actualmente, doña Carmen desea compra concentrado y vitaminas para cerdos y así poder seguir con su trabajo y poderle dar a su hija lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Carmen has been raising and selling pigs for several years and she comes with very good references from her neighbors because she is very hardworking, responsible, honest, enterprising, and has customers loyal to her products.  She lives with her 18 year old daughter who currently attends school.  Carmen wants to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for pigs so she can continue with her work and be able to provide her daughter with what she needs without limit.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Griselda Carolina

texts.es: Doña Griselda de 42 años de edad  vive en casa propia  junto con su esposo  ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce y pan francés  desde hace 6 años es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable  con ganas de salir  adelante  posee una gran demanda  por la variedad de alimentos que vende, con su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo  ha logrado  solventar  algunos de sus gastos  ella solicita un crédito  para la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración del pan como: harina, levadura,  huevos,  leche entre otros  y así poder satisfacer  la gran demanda que posee y mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad  de vida.
texts.en: Griselda is 42 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband.  She has been making sweet and French bread for six years and she is a very hardworking, responsible woman with a desire to get ahead.  She has many demands because of the variety of food she sells.  Her work and help from her husband have allowed her to help pay some of her expenses and she is asking for a loan to buy the ingredients she needs, such as flour, yeast, eggs, milk and other things to make bread.  In this way she will be able to satisfy demand and improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria de 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica la venta de antojitos desde hace mas de 30 años, es una persona servicial, trabajadora, con excelente moral de pago, es muy amble con sus clientes lo que la ha llevado a obtener gran demanda por sus productos, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares, ella solicita  un crédito para invertir en su negocio compra de materia prima como papas, yuca, plátanos, aceite, etc. para elaborar sus productos, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 48 years old, lives in her own home with her life-partner and son. She has made a living selling snacks for more than 30 years. She is a helpful, hardworking person with excellent payment morals. She is very kind with her customers, which has created a great demand for her products. Thanks to her work she has been able to settle some of her family expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing raw materials like potatoes, yucca, plantains, oil, etc. to produce her products, obtain a higher income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like potatoes, yucca, plantains, oil, etc.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah is 36 years old. He is from Nakuru, and he is single.

He has a business of distributing internet and playstation games for children, which he has been operating for the last seven years. He has applied for his third loan of 20,000 KES from Kadet Ltd. which he intends to use for the expansion of his business by buying more playstations to meet the needs of many of the children who access him.

Josiah's hope and dream for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more playstations to sell

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Mariatu from Tombo, in rural Western Area in Freetown Penninsula. She is married with four children. Two of her children are going to school. 

After her wedding, Mariatu established her cookery business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge she has encountered is a lack of capital to run her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings to prepare food for her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to own a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings to prepare food her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy a water tank for storing enough clean water to benefit six family members. They face a challenge of lack of enough water storage facilities. He hopes that in the future he will grow economically and socially. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn is a teacher, while her husband is a farmer. Rizalyn runs their farming business, primarily farming rice and corn. Rizalyn and her husband are blessed with three children. Because of their desire to enhance their lifestyle, Rizalyn and her husband worked hard to send their children to school and finish their studies. Now, Rizalyn's two children are working while the youngest is still taking up college education.

Rizalyn's goal is for all of her children becomes professionals soon. Even though she is in teaching profession, she also does some farming activities. Rizalyn is requesting a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy herbicides, and to pay for the labor costs of farming. She will keep on striving until she achieves her goal.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, and to pay for labor costs in farming.

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús

texts.es:
Amparo es una mujer de 62 años de edad, madre de 6 hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con ella y trabaja en un taller mecanico y en las labores agrícolas.  Lastimosamente, Amparo no tiene ningún grado de educación.

 se dedica ala agricultura,  actividad que realiza desde hace 45 años y lo aprendió de sus padres.  Se tarda 5 minutas para llegar donde tiene sembrado 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, también cuida una vaca con su pequeño ternero, la vaca le esta dando leche la cual pastorea en una pequeña parcela cerca de su casa.

Necesita el crédito para la compra  de 6 sacos de abono,  pesticidas, medicamento para ella y para realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda.
